Title: Data Analyst / Scientist (M/F/X)
HTML:
Société

parking.brussels est une jeune agence gouvernementale dynamique, en pleine croissance. Notre devise « mieux se garer pour mieux bouger », résume notre vision ambitieuse pour améliorer la mobilité. Notre objectif ? Harmoniser les règles de stationnement dans toute la Région bruxelloise, en collaboration avec les 19 communes. Dans cette perspective, et en vue d’œuvrer à une ville plus agréable et durable, nous sommes régulièrement en quête de nouveaux collaborateurs.

Fonction

Statut : Contractuel

Contrat : A durée indéterminée

Nombre de postes : 2

Localisation : Bruxelles

Niveau d’études : Ingénieur / Master (enseignement supérieur de type long)

Société : Agence du stationnement de la Région Bruxelles-Capitale

Vous intégrez parking.brussels en tant que Data Analyst / Scientist, dans l’optique d’y collaborer à la maîtrise et la gouvernance des données, et d’accompagner l’évolution digitale de l’entreprise, au sein d’un nouveau département dédié au management de la data. Au-delà de vos activités propres, vous aurez ainsi l’opportunité d’accompagner l’Agence dans sa transition digitale.

Responsabilites & Tâches (liste Non Exhaustives)

Sous la responsabilité du Data Manager, et en collaboration avec les services de support (IT et Technologie) et les départements métier (On-street, Off-street, Finances …) :

  • Vous appréhendez les différents aspects relatifs aux données générées ou produites par l’entreprise (localisation, accès, formats, structures et contenus) ;
  • Vous êtes chargé de l’analyse de ces données, dont vous procédez au traitement (extraction, intégration, tests, contrôles qualité, consolidation, enrichissement ...) et à la restitution statistique (tableaux, graphiques, rapports dynamiques, cartographies) destinée à en faciliter la compréhension et l’utilisation ;
  • Au-delà de ces aspects d’analyse, vous exploitez toutes données disponibles sous la forme d’indicateurs pertinents eu égard aux besoins et impératifs de parking.brussels en matière de gouvernance, politique interne / externe, reporting, études et suivi opérationnel / contractuel ;
  • Vous participez dans ce cadre à la mise en place des processus et outils permettant l’importation / centralisation des données (au sein d’une solution de type Data Warehouse) ainsi que leur restitution dynamique (dashboard), en vue de systématiser et automatiser tant leur exploitation que leur visualisation et diffusion ;
  • Vous vous tenez informé des évolutions techniques relatives à ces processus et outils, et êtes en mesure de formuler des propositions à cet égard ;
  • Sur base de vos activités et travaux, vous faites des recommandations quant à l’amélioration des processus opérationnels et des positionnements stratégiques de l’entreprise ;
  • Vous documentez rigoureusement l’ensemble des étapes et procédures impliquées dans vos travaux ;
  • Vous prenez en charge les procédures de marchés publics associées à vos domaines d'intervention et votre champ d'expertise.

Profil

FORMATION

Vous êtes titulaire d’un Master (en data science, sciences exactes, statistique ou informatique).

COMPÉTENCES TECHNIQUES

  • Vous disposez d’une expertise, idéalement via une expérience professionnelle pertinente, dans l’intégration, le traitement et l’analyse de sources de données corrélées, multiples et hétérogènes (y compris de séries temporelles et de données géospatiales) ;
  • Vous avez une bonne maîtrise des méthodes et principes d’analyses statistiques, et disposez d’une connaissance des outils de reporting BI ;
  • Vous disposez du bagage informatique et technique suffisant pour la bonne exécution des tâches incombant à la fonction, et démontrez d’une expérience pratique associée à ce bagage (une expérience préalable avec le langage Python, et ses librairies d’analyse et de visualisation est recommandée) ;
  • De la manière générale, vous êtes conscient de la diversité des domaines de la Data Science et du Big Data, ainsi que des implications associées au développement d’un projet tel que le MaaS ;
  • Vous avez une connaissance du GIS, idéalement d’un logiciel en accès libre, ou êtes prêt à vous former en la matière ;
  • Vous justifiez d’une approche scientifique et rigoureuse de votre travail, ainsi que de facultés analytiques ;
  • Vous disposez de qualités rédactionnelles ;
  • Une expertise dans le domaine du stationnement ou de la mobilité, en particulier acquise en Région de Bruxelles-Capitale, ou un certificat de conseiller en mobilité (type CEMA) sont des atouts ;
  • Vous avez une bonne connaissance de la Région de Bruxelles-Capitale, en ce compris de son contexte institutionnel, et des politiques qui y sont menées en matière de stationnement et de mobilité ;
  • Vous êtes capable de rédiger un cahier des charges et de mener une procédure de marché public ;
  • Vous avez au minimum une connaissance passive de l’autre langue nationale (Fr ou NL), ainsi que de l’anglais.

COMPÉTENCES COMPORTEMENTALES

  • Être organisé.e et planifier son travail en vue de la concrétisation des objectifs fixés ;
  • Savoir travailler en autonomie et prendre des initiatives tout en cultivant l’esprit d’équipe et de collaboration ;
  • Disposer d’aptitudes analytiques et de logique, ainsi que d’une approche scientifique et d’un sens critique ;
  • Intégrer, traiter et synthétiser l’information ;
  • Faire preuve de pédagogie, conseiller, soutenir et savoir argumenter ;
  • Être à l’écoute et savoir s’adapter ;
  • S’auto-développer.

Offre

Vous serez engagé en qualité d’Attaché (A101) avec le barème de traitement correspondant.

AVANTAGES

  • Une fonction stratégique dans une jeune institution publique, en pleine évolution, qui valorise votre implication ;
  • Un équilibre harmonieux entre travail et vie privée grâce à un horaire flexible dans la prestation des 38h hebdomadaires et aux possibilités de télétravail ;
  • Chèques-repas d'une valeur de 8 euros par jour de prestation ;
  • Un capital congé attrayant (35 jours et fermeture de fin d’année) ;
  • Gratuité des transports en commun pour le trajet domicile-travail sur Bruxelles et en dehors de Bruxelles ;
  • Assurance hospitalisation pour vous et les membres de votre ménage (conjoint et enfants);
  • Une indemnité pour le télétravail de 50 euros net par mois ;
  • Prime de fin d’année ;
  • Primes pour divers évènements (mariage, naissance, Saint-Nicolas, etc.) ;
  • Chèques-cadeau (Noël et anniversaires) ;
  • Possibilité de recevoir une prime pour les déplacements en vélo ;
  • Possibilité de bénéficier d’une prime de bilinguisme ;
  • Nombreuses possibilités de formations (à suivre durant les heures de travail) ;
  • PC et GSM de société avec abonnement téléphonique ;

LA PROCÉDURE DE SÉLECTION

Vous êtes convaincu.e d'avoir le profil adéquat pour cette fonction ? Téléchargez votre CV et votre lettre de motivation en cliquant sur « postuler maintenant ». Vous recevrez ensuite un e-mail de confirmation de votre candidature.

Les candidat.e.s retenu.e.s seront invité.e.s à participer à la procédure de sélection au sein de l’Agence du stationnement de la Région Bruxelles-Capitale.

En tant que personne présentant un handicap, un trouble ou une maladie, vous pouvez demander des aménagements raisonnables de la procédure de sélection. Vous devez mentionner ceci au moment de l’envoi de votre C.V.

Date limite pour le dépôt de la candidature : 01/09/2024

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
What can you expect?

Python Predictions is currently looking for a Senior Data Scientist. As we are growing fast, we are looking for people to support and participate in this growth. We are looking for a person with a passion for data science, interested in leading concrete business projects in a wide variety of domains and applications.

In this role, you will work closely with other Data Profiles from Python Predictions but also from our clients’ internal teams. You will lead the way and participate in multiple advanced analytics projects from the ideation phase to the value delivery. Every step of the way, you will ensure the quality of the analytical solution as well as the actionability towards the business stakeholders.

As a Senior Data Scientist, you will be invited to coach junior team members and share your experience.

Does this sound like your ideal day-to-day drill? Then don’t wait any longer and let’s meet.




Who are we looking for?

You have multiple years of experience in a variety of data science applications (not all, but not limited to one either).
You understand that organizations today should make the most of the available information, in order to turn this information into value. You have acquired relevant skills through your past experiences.
You are as proficient in Python as you are in English, Dutch or French (all other (programming) languages are a plus).
You are motivated by obtaining concrete deliverables and results. You want to make a difference for the organizations you work for, and you like to be recognized for your input.
You can work independently, but you also appreciate collaboration. You are open-minded and have no fear of expressing your opinion in a constructive way.
You have experience in project management and people management.




What do we have to offer?

Python Predictions is a Brussels-based service provider specialized in data projects with business impact.
In January 2020, Python Predictions joined Tobania – a leading Belgian business & technology consulting firm. And in turn, in March 2023, Tobania joined Sopra Steria – a major Tech player in Europe recognized for its consulting, digital services and software development.
Great variation in job content due to short and long term missions in different industries, different domains and different environments.
A competitive salary, with plenty of fringe benefits.
A diverse team of supportive colleagues with different backgrounds, skills and interests but shared values who’ll make you feel right at home.
The opportunity to turn these new colleagues into friends during our legendary afterwork drinks and other exciting events.
In-company training adapted to your personal needs.
Continuous learning in monthly team meetings and personal development time.
A chance to exploit your talents in our Tobania.Academy and on-the-job coaching.
A workstation at one of our customers’ offices, at Python’s Brussels office but also at any Tobania’s location!

Show more

Title: Computer Vision Engineer
Description:
At Axon, we’re on a mission to Protect Life. We’re explorers, addressing society’s most critical safety and justice issues with our ecosystem of devices and cloud software. Like our products, we work better together. Life at Axon is fast-paced, challenging, and meaningful. Here, you’ll take ownership and drive real change. You’ll enjoy all the advantages of our group: stability, cutting-edge equipment, evolution, etc.

New Ventures is a department within Axon that drives innovation through dedicated R&D and rapid prototyping. Following Axon's acquisition of SkyHero, the leading Brussels-based provider of tactical UAVs and UGVs, our focus has intensified on creating cutting-edge indoor aerial and ground drones for elite tactical teams. As part of Sky-Hero’s team, you’ll join a real family with strong collaboration, flexibility and open-mindedness.

We are seeking a Computer Vision expert to take a leading and strategic role in the research and development of advanced sensing and mapping features for cutting-edge UAV and UGV reconnaissance products.

Your mission


Prototyping and researching sensor fusion algorithms for Visual Inertial Odometry (VIO) and SLAM (Simultaneous Localization and Mapping) with other autonomy, embedded software, and computer vision teams.
Implementing and validating selected algorithms on-device, ensuring real-time performance.
Leading the design and development of testing and simulation to ensure product quality in demanding environments.
Collaborating with internationally distributed teams (Imaging, AI, Software) and participating in business travel to various offices worldwide.


Your Profile


Min 3 years' experience
English proficiency


Our Offer


Very attractive salary on 14th months
Meal vouchers to boost your purchasing power
Important bonus to valorize your work
30 days of paid leave
Stock options
Parking facilities
Ideal and strategic location
Comprehensive insurances coverage
Real and continuous career advancement opportunities
Unique opportunity to build and develop a significant and renowned professional network in the global market
Flexible working hours that consider your personal life
Home working to balance your personal organization
An environment where autonomy and trust prevail
Flat hierarchy, where you actively participate in decisions
A cohesive team to work under the best conditions
Events that offer personal fulfillment and cultural enrichment
And much more!


ALL APPLICATIONS WILL BE TREATED WITH THE UTMOST CONFIDENTIALITY.
Show more

Title: Junior Software Engineer DIGI
Description:
DIGI BE welcomes you. We've set foot in the telecom landscape with a singular mission - to disrupt and redefine. With audacious goals and an unyielding ambition, we're forging a path that is fiercely customer-centric and rooted in innovation. Prepare to witness a revolution in telecom, because DIGI BE isn't just here to play; we're here to lead and transform.

To support us in this mission, we are currently looking for a Junior Software Engineer.

Are you the one we’re looking for? Keep reading!

The objective of this role are activities to ensure technical support in the creation of computer programs, according to

predefined specifications and their assembly into coherent systems, including testing to ensure

compliance with the specifications.


Software Product Production:


Ensure the production of high-quality software products.


Platform Development:


Develop and enhance PAS, SAAS platforms utilized for running software products.


Optimization and Monitoring:


Follow key indicators to ensure optimal software system functioning.

Conduct audits and monitor the performance of platforms and software products.

Adapt and integrate systems for maximum performance.


Availability and Delivery:


Ensure maximum availability of software services.

Create development, testing, and automated delivery platforms for software products.


Security Implementation:


Develop and implement security policies for software systems.


Documentation:


Document solutions, incidents, and tools used for software systems.


Tool Development:


Write and develop tools to enhance IT systems functionality, reporting, installation, and administration.


Version Testing:


Study, search, and test new software/hardware versions to ensure maximum performance.


Data Backup:


Maintain backup copies of all platform or application data.


Compliance and Communication:


Acquire, inform, and adhere to decisions, internal notes, procedures, and updated work instructions.

Propose improvements for departmental activities.

Job requirements

Must Have Qualities & Talents


Very good knowledge of English and French/ Dutch
Knows Windows, Linux operating systems.
Average knowledge of programming.
Knowledge of HTML, PHP OR JAVA Java Script.
Knowledge of MySQL, MsSQL, PgSQL databases.
Ability to adapt and integrate systems for optimal performance.
Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.
Proactive attitude and a continuous improvement mindset.


What We Offer


Full-time permanent contract.
An exceptionally contemporary workplace, where we prioritize a warm and people-centric atmosphere, ensuring that your daily experience takes center stage.
We place a strong emphasis on flexibility and hybrid work arrangements to promote a harmonious work-life balance
You work 40 hours per week. But they really fly by here! And as a result, you get an extra 12 days off per year if you work full-time
Celebrate good times with our lively events squad! They whip up a variety of happenings, from mouthwatering BBQs and sizzling Friday fry-ups to relaxed after-work socials and an annual family extravaganza, plus a whole bunch of other exciting adventures.
Seize the chance to start an exhilarating journey with DIGI, where innovation meets ambition in the ever-evolving telecom landscape.


Curious For More?

Do you feel addressed by our company and are you ready for a unique experience? Then apply for this vacancy today!
Show more

Title: Quantative Developer Internship
Description:
We are looking for:

A Junior Analyst who is quantitatively driven and has an interest to work with NFTs. You may have already explored NFT trading either personally or professionally and have an interest in working with large data sets. In this role you will collaborate with like-minded people to develop solutions for our trading activities.

You may be a dynamic analyst who is quantitatively driven and has an interest in track record in programming; DeFi, and data science are subjects you already have explored. In your role, you will collaborate with like-minded people to develop solutions for our trading activities.

Job Description

This role will be focusing on the liquidity provision of NFT ecosystems. You will have a heavy emphasis on data analytical modelling and potentially financial strategies. The role will be also be supporting our existing trading teams working in our NFT Business Unit.

Skills Needed


Understanding of how to pull data from the blockchain
Knows how to read and present data or parse it to create models
An interest or experience in financial strategies, e.g. arbitrage (not essential)
Knowledge of SQL
A degree of technical aptitude with programming skills across any software languages for example: Python/C++/C/Rust or Java (not essential)
Any exposure into trading NFT’s would be highly advantageous
Exposure to DeFi ecosystems would be highly advantageous


Interview process:

1st Stage is a short technical interview with the Hiring Manager

2nd stage: Tech Challenge

3rd Stage: Tech Challenge Debrief

4th Stage: Final meeting with the wider team

Offer

Our recruitment philosophy

We believe the most important aspect of our recruitment process is self-awareness: we are looking for people who have a clear understanding of themselves and what they are looking for in their professional career. That means that we expect to work with people who not only have the right skills, but who have also made the conscious decision to look for a company in our industry and with our characteristics and are willing to ask questions and learn in a context that may not be familiar to them.

Our offer


A 6 month paid internship at Belgians leading digital assets company
The standard type of contract used in Belgium for professional internships is a so-called convention d'immersion professionnelle, with a fixed salary of ~1k EUR
The opportunity to learn about digital assets and blockchain from a 30,000 ft view of the entire ecosystem
Working from one of Brussels newest, nicest and most advanced office spaces


We have a strong preference for the internship to take place on-site in Belgium. In rare cases, for candidates based outside of Belgium, an alternative type of contract can be considered.

Keyrock offers you both a career and a large range of benefits that we will gladly discuss in the course of the application process.

As an employer we are committed to build an inclusive, diverse and non-discriminating work environment. We welcome employees of all backgrounds, ethnicities, genders, creed and sexual orientation. We hire, reward and promote entirely based on merit and performance.

Title: Consultant in Data Science
Description:
Sia Partners is a specialist Management Consulting firm created in 1999 and has grown into a global firm with approximately 3000 employees and annual revenue exceeding $400m. Our culture is strongly orientated towards high-quality expertise and delivering excellent results and outcomes for our clients, which include a wide range of multinational companies. Our global presence and our expertise in more than 40 sectors and services allows us to accompany clients worldwide. Using innovative technologies such as our own in-house apps, social networks, and digital tools, we provide a truly integrated global service.

Through Consulting for Good, we put our expertise at the service of our clients' climate objectives and make sustainable development a performance lever for our clients. Our portfolio of offerings is cross-sectors and 17 % of our revenue is generated from engagements with a CSR focus.




Job Description



As a consultant in Data Science, you will be involved in transformation projects at our clients. You will execute project assignments in modelling and digital transformation (business/IT analysis and partial coding) environments with a good deal of business perspectives:

Machine learning, AI and statistics: developing predictive models of decision making (supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms, econometrics, forecasting, quantitative diagnosis,...)
Operational research : assistance in the design and implementation of constraint optimization solutions and simulation models
Big Data : Algorithmic knowledge for large and unstructured data processing

You will get the opportunity to actively contribute to Sia Partners’ internal activities:

Development and reinforcement of our offer, by understanding and interpreting data science innovation and challenges
Business development, by contributing to need definition and participating in our commercial initiatives

Equipped with the entrepreneurial fibre, you are ready to cooperate in a fast growing company.

In return, you can expect:

An international company that gives importance to diversity, inclusion, employee well-being and corporate social responsibilities actions.
A great working atmosphere with friendly and professional colleagues where innovation and entrepreneurship are encouraged
A personal development plan with a regular follow-up as well training opportunities to develop yourself
A competitive salary with great advantages, like mobility budget, hospital insurance, performance -related bonus,...


Qualifications


University Master Civil Engineer (applied mathematics, IT or similar)
0 to 3 years’ experience as a consultant
Outstanding team player with great interpersonal and communication skills
Strong interest in data science and related sectors such as Energy and Finance
Analytical mind, exploring options and able to synthesize into conclusions
Dynamic, result oriented, rigorous and committed
Trilingual: French, Dutch and English
Prepared to participate in temporary assignments abroad


Additional Information



We are unable to provide a work permit for this position

Sia Partners is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or discipline, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs.

Show more

  • University Master Civil Engineer (applied mathematics, IT or similar)
  • 0 to 3 years’ experience as a consultant
  • Outstanding team player with great interpersonal and communication skills
  • Strong interest in data science and related sectors such as Energy and Finance
  • Analytical mind, exploring options and able to synthesize into conclusions
  • Dynamic, result oriented, rigorous and committed
  • Trilingual: French, Dutch and English
  • Prepared to participate in temporary assignments abroad

Additional Information

We are unable to provide a work permit for this position

Sia Partners is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or discipline, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs.

Title: Robotics Software Engineer – Onboard Autonomy
Description:
The Robotics Software and Intelligence (RSI) Division is responsible for the study, design, prototyping and development of state-of-the-art robotics products for our customers.




Position




The position involves engaging in the development of multi-agent mission planning for robotics systems. The successful candidate will be involved in the analysis, simulation, development, and testing of coordinated task and path planning for multi-agent systems, with integration into both offline control centres and onboard robotic platforms for real-time operations.




The position is central to projects spanning marine, terrestrial, and planetary robotics, contributing to applied research initiatives and on European Space Agency (ESA), European Commission (EC), as well as defence and commercial projects.




The successful candidate will be part of the Robotics, Software & Intelligence (RSI) Team.

The candidate will mainly report to the RSI Team Lead.




Location: Sint-Stevens-Woluwe (Brussels Area)
Start date: As of November 2024




Tasks and Responsibilities




Analyse and develop offline and online mission planning techniques composed of goal decomposition, tasks allocation, path/trajectory planning and adaptation to dynamic events using Artificial Intelligence (AI) or optimisation approaches
Develop command, control & intelligence software applications with integrated mission planning
Participate in the end-to-end implementation with testing, integration and optimisation of target robot architecture
Implement the developed technologies in the in-house robotic control centre and integrate them with mobile and underwater robots
Generate the technical documentation required all along the process.




Skills and Experience




MSc or PhD in relevant fields (e.g. AI/Machine Learning, robotics, computer science, software engineering)




Strong theoretical and practical background in:

Classical AI and/or optimisation techniques
Operational research
Planning domain description
Ontology based knowledge representation
Semantic reasoning - applied to multi-robot mission planning paradigms




In addition:

Very strong programming skills (C++, Python) on Linux environment and Git tools
Thorough experience of Software development in ROS and simulation in Gazebo
Strength to cope with schedules and deadlines
Fluent in English, both spoken and written with good skills in technical documentation delivery.




Considered as Assets




Knowledge of OWL, PDDL and other ontology representations
Machine Learning techniques (supervised, unsupervised, reinforcement learning) and Deep Learning via TensorFlow, Keras, etc.
Knowledge of web technologies such as JavaScript, Node.js, HTML5, etc.
Robotics software architectures (design), Robotics Middleware and Networks
Onboard autonomy
Continuous Integration methodologies.




Our Offer




Working within an exceptional sector with Staff located in Belgium, Germany and the Netherlands
A professional and modern working environment with motivated Administrative Staff, Engineers, Astronaut Training Instructors and Scientists coming from all different horizons and countries with a common passion for space and their own expertise
A full-time position with an indefinite contract of employment
A competitive remuneration package and good working conditions
Working from home in part can be a possibility
An individualised training and development programmes.




About Us




Space Applications Services is a Company at the forefront of space technology development and the provision of services for human spaceflight, exploration and earth observation missions. Headquartered in Belgium (Brussels Area), with a research office in the Netherlands and a subsidiary in the USA, the Company provides solutions for both commercial and institutional customers. We work with Clients such as the European Space Agency, the European Commission, governmental and national space agencies as well as the major space industries.

The Company develops payloads, avionics, robotics technology and products, and provides complete mission operations control centre solutions to EN9100 standards.

The Company also provides engineering, science and training services, including astronaut training.

From our headquarters, we are in daily contact with the International Space Station (ISS) ensuring our Customers’ research is successful.




How To Apply




Upload your CV, Motivation Letter and a Reference Letter, to the attention of Mr Shashank Govindaraj.




The candidate shall be eligible to work in the European Union for a couple of years.

Show more

Title: Data Science Consultant Min. 2 years experience, fluent in NL
Description:
The team, position & mission:




Are you passionate about data? Do you like creating a real impact by tackling some real-world problems our clients face by developing algorithms for recommendation engines, developing natural language processing algorithms or employing deep learning methods on information? If you answered yes, this could be the job for you! As a Data Scientist, your job will be to propose and develop advanced analytical models for a series of different clients and in different industries like life science, media, public, banking, insurance and others.




Your key areas of responsibility as a Data Science Consultant:




Proposing and developing advanced analytical models for a series of different clients and in different industries like life science, media, public, banking, insurance and others.
Working as a consultant for big clients, accompanied by your colleague experts in the field. An analytical career path will help you to develop your skills and obtain your objectives on the long term.




As an ideal candidate you have:




A master’s degree or PhD in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Business Engineering, Physics or any related field
2-5 years relevant experience in data science / data analysis / data mining
Passionate about data and/or statistical analysis, with mathematics and modelling skills
Experience in at least one of the following sectors: Banking, Finance, Risk, Marketing, Customer Intelligence, Life Sciences
Experience with SQL
Some experience with data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, ...) is a plus
Experience with applying regression, classification, natural language processing, clustering/ segmentation, time-series forecasting, anomaly detection or predictive maintenance is a must
Proficiency in data sourcing (web-scraping, API, etc.), data transformation and data preparation techniques
Excellent programming knowledge in Python and/or R
Good coding practices and code refactoring experience is an advantage
Interest in machine learning, deep learning and/or MLOps
Experience using Cloud Data Platforms (Azure, GCP, ...) for Data Science projects is a plus
Ability to understand the business requirements and develop new/existing algorithms to satisfy those requirements
Strong communication and presentation skills
Being able to explain technical concepts to a non-technical audience and explainable AI is an advantage
Conceptual and creative thinking
A plus: Hands on experience in Enterprise Intelligence (e.g., Data Warehousing, Data Management, Business Intelligence, Analytics, Big Data ecosystem)
Fluent in English and French and/or Dutch
Experience in using tools leveraging Generative AI and/or developing yourself projects that make use of Generative AI is a plus




What we offer you:




Hybrid ways of working with access to our modern & collaborative offices in Brussels
We may work with tomorrow’s technology, but at our core we are a people-oriented organization and we are proud to have our Great Place to Work certification
An open and inclusive culture, that enables us to reach our full potential
A community of experts - as Digital Natives, we put innovation at the heart of our expertise
Read more about the benefits we offer here




About Orange Business:

Orange Business is a leading network and digital integrator company with offices in 65 countries worldwide, and part of the Orange Group.




Digital Services, a business line of Orange Business is a newly created division within Orange Business. In Europe the business line consists of approximately 1500 people distributed across 9 countries. We are digital natives, with innovation at the core of our business, which makes us a reliable partner close to our customers. Our joint mission is to help innovate, drive and lead them in their digital transformation challenges and business strategies in key digital domains, including Cloud, Customer Experience, Digital Workspace and Data & AI. As an agile and fast-moving digital business partner, the business line offers trusted end-to-end solutions and products that help businesses in a wide range of industries in the private and public sector transform their operations, enhance customer experience, and drive growth.




With our digital expertise, we are a strategic partner of Orange Business objectives to be a leading network and digital integrator with our team as a key growth engine.

Title: Software Engineer
Description:
Software Engineer




Mission




As Software Engineer, you actively participate in the delivery of external (Customer Solution) and/or Internal IT Projects (Product & Administrative Solutions). You also participate in the Analysis, Estimation, Designing, Building, Testing, Documenting, and Implementing of Customer Solutions

In addition, you maintain and enhance existing solutions (Change Request Delivery) and providing 2nd level support (Support process).




Responsibilities




As Software Engineer, your responsibilities will be to:




Analyze, develop, test, maintain, fix, write supporting document of customer solutions and Speos Administrative solutions.
Review and improve existing code.
Participate in the continuous improvement of the Client Application Development.
Provide 2nd level support, identify root-causes & resolution, respect support procedures.
Resolve Malfunctions, Bugs, Deploying Fixes.
Provide technical coaching and guidance to Service Managers & Coordinators.
Participate in the creation and validation of functional documentation of a project.
Take the lead in the creation and validation of technical documentation of a project.
Build solutions according to agreed specifications, within speos standards & guidelines.
Test & deploying solutions based on pre-defined acceptance criteria and procedures.




Profile




As Software Engineer, you have:




A bachelor degree in IT or equivalent by experience
Very good command in French or Dutch and English
Experience with the following technologies:
Java & Spring Boot: Intermediate - Building and deploying enterprise applications
JavaScript/TypeScript: Beginner - Basic development
SQL: Basic - Writing queries

Tools & Platforms:

Git & GitLab: Intermediate - Version control and CI/CD
APIs & Testing: Postman - API development and testing
IDEs: IntelliJ, Visual Studio Code, UltraEdit - Efficient coding environments
Databases: DB2, MariaDB, MongoDB - Querying
AWS: Beginner - Basic cloud deployment
Project Management: Jira, Confluence - Task management and documentation
Remote Computing: MobaXterm, SSH, SFTP




Preferred:

Quadient® Inspire Designer & Inspire Content Manager: Experience is a plus
Visual Basic: Basic - Maintaining legacy services




And you also are

A great team player with experience in working within a project structure.
Analytic and Structural thinking.
Transparent & pro-active Mindset.
Whenever possible, propose improvements in performance in the environment and in company security.




Our offer

A competitive salary package - Your salary comes with extra-legal benefits, such as a company car, profit sharing, group and hospitalization insurance and meal vouchers.
Lots of autonomy and flexibility for direct impact on the growth of speos.
A stimulating and evolving role with many challenges, opportunities, and innovative projects.
A dynamic team in a family company culture!
A unique atmosphere, collegiality, and conviviality.

You will join us in a diverse team of highly talented colleagues, where there is room for ideas, initiative, and professional development.




Why speos ?

speos is an innovative, leading Belgian company that develops solutions designed to empower companies with optimized and secure administrative and financial processes. We manage all aspects of your outbound document workflow, from document generation to distribution across print and digital channels.

The ultimate goal of speos is to ensure the success of our customers' administrative and financial processes. This allows them to concentrate all their efforts on their core business.

speos' strategy and its position as a subsidiary of the bpost group since 2001 make us the #1 reference in our field of expertise in Belgium. We owe this recognition to our ambitious management, state-of-the-art technological know-how and proven customer service.

Title: Full Stack Engineer
Description:
About the Company

CrypDefi is a secure gateway platform between custody & DeFi. It enables companies to instantly capture alpha on new chains or DeFi, without any counterparty risk. CrypDefi immediately integrates all major custodians with brand-new DeFi, and facilitates asset bridging across wallets & chains. It signs transactions for any chain, and supports new ones within a week.




What we're building

A middleware layer that interacts through API calls with all the big crypto custodian platforms (Fireblocks, ForDefi, BitGo, Copper, …).
A frontend, single-pane-of-glass visualization offering a complete overview of our client's assets, transactions, usage, …
Our own MPC & high-frequency omni-chain signing solution.
Automation flows to seamlessly create wallets, move assets between wallets, transfer funds across custodians, bridge assets across chains, …




What we look for in you

You're passionate about writing code, and have at least 2 years of experience in 2 of the following tech stacks: Golang, C++, React, Next.js, Rust, Kubernetes. If you're an amazing code wizard in another language, please let us know!
You're an enthusiastic person with a 'can do' mind-set. Challenges don't scare you, but 100% excite you!
You're proactive & self-driven to work in remote environments and deliver. However, always welcome at our office in Brussels.
You appreciate candid feedback & direct communication. Of course, this goes both ways, and we will be more than happy to also learn from you!
You're able to think along our vision, identify potential gaps & build solutions. We're not looking for someone who just completes tasks, rather someone who can take ownership & responsibility of their own stream, build it and help us reach our goals.
You can pivot on the fly. Crypto evolves all the time, and so can our priorities. What you've worked on in the past might not be what you will be working on tomorrow. You're not looking for a boring job; this excites you.
You embrace the startup lifestyle and have a work hard play hard mentality. You're able to see bigger picture and are willing to go the extra mile.
You're a winner.

Bonus:

You're a front-end god with knowledge on design and UX.




What we offer

Salary: the salary range will be determined throughout the interview process depending on experience and skills.
Stock options: as a startup, we want to give you ownership of the company to make sure our goals are yours as well.
Remote working possibility: although we prefer candidates that are able to meet in Brussels at least every once in a while, we are open to discuss.
Rapid learning & growth: every day will be different, and as one of our first employees you'll have every chance to grow with the company.
Stellar team: the opportunity to work with 3 top-of-the-class engineers from Belgium, with contacts & investing execs from major industry players.
Show more

Title: Java / Kotlin developer
Description:
Java/Kotlin-minded en op zoek naar een job in software development?

Bij ons bouw jij mee aan uitdagende projecten in Industry, E-Learning & Healthcare, gebruikmakende van innovative technologieën, zoals Internet Of Things, Machine Learning, AgriTech, Smart Health Solutions, enz.




Kom terecht in een sprankelend team waar jij jezelf volledig kunt ontplooien! Druk mee je stempel op onze organisatie en onze way-of-working.




Je functie




Ontwerp en ontwikkel complexe Java/Kotlin web applicaties op maat van de klant
We geloven er sterk in dat pair programming de manier is om echt samen te werken met collega's
Werk remote, vanuit ons kantoor in Merelbeke of on-site bij klanten in West- en Oost-Vlaanderen
Streef naar kwaliteit en stabiliteit van je gemaakte front-end en/of back-end applicaties, hiervoor gebruik je graag TDD
Indien gewenst combineer je development met contact met de klant, team coaching, pre-sales, functionele en business analyse, data analytics, ...




Profiel




Veel goesting en goeie dosis humor
Bachelor of master diploma in een ICT-richting
Gedreven om wat nieuw is in onze dynamische software industrie te blijven bijleren
Je hebt reeds enkele jaren professionele ervaring in de Software Industrie
Ervaring met frameworks zoals Spring Boot, Vue.js is een troef
Voordeel als je kennis hebt van en/of ervaring hebt in: SQL, NoSQL, Docker, Gradle, Webpack, Reactive programming, …
Je communiceert vlot in het Nederlands en Engels




VINCI Energies wil een inclusieve werkgever zijn, een plek waar iedereen zich goed voelt, waar iedereen gelijke kansen krijgt, ongeacht geslacht, gender of cultuur.

Alle zij's, die's en hij's hebben het recht om te zijn wie ze zijn en moeten de kans krijgen om zich ten volle te ontplooien. Wij zien diversiteit als een sterkte en het is onze basis voor duurzaam ondernemen. Daarom staan onze vacatures open voor iedereen die voldoet aan de competenties zoals omschreven in de jobomschrijving.




Waarom ons vervoegen?




Je start in het team van Axians Business Applications.

Door de vlakke structuur slagen we erin om een cultuur te onderhouden waar medewerkers centraal staan en waar collega's elke dag voor en met elkaar het beste van zichzelf kunnen geven.

We zetten in op verbinding tussen collega's zodat ze betrokken blijven bij het reilen en zeilen van Business Applications, bv door laagdremplige kennisdeling over alle teams heen via bv lean coffee en lunch & learn sessies.

Omdat het niet altijd over bv. NoSQL en GraphQL hoeft te gaan, organiseren we op frequente basis activiteiten zoals boardgame nights, highland games, ... en zelfs onze eigen Axians-masked singer wedstrijd B-)

Bij Business Applications kunnen we dus enkel vooruit gaan als we allemaal samen vooruit gaan.




Onze organisatie




Axians maakt deel uit van de sterke groep VINCI Energies
Teamwerk, organisatiebetrokkenheid en zelfontwikkeling
Variatie door verschillende klanten en activiteiten
Opleiding op maat om je start optimaal te begeleiden
Duidelijke loopbaanpaden met zicht op je toekomst en doorgroeimogelijkheden
Een marktconform brutoloon, aangevuld met firmawagen, hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering, maaltijd- en ecocheques, gsm-abonnement, collectieve bonus, mogelijkheid tot voordelig aankopen van VINCI-aandelen, etc.
Een gedreven én waarden-gedreven organisatie met oog voor mens & maatschappij
Tal van initiatieven rond kennisdeling, sportieve/culturele/familiale activiteiten.
Mogelijkheid tot thuiswerk

Show more
HTML:
Java/Kotlin-minded en op zoek naar een job in software development?

Bij ons bouw jij mee aan uitdagende projecten in Industry, E-Learning & Healthcare, gebruikmakende van innovative technologieën, zoals Internet Of Things, Machine Learning, AgriTech, Smart Health Solutions, enz.


Kom terecht in een sprankelend team waar jij jezelf volledig kunt ontplooien! Druk mee je stempel op onze organisatie en onze way-of-working.


Je functie


  • Ontwerp en ontwikkel complexe Java/Kotlin web applicaties op maat van de klant
  • We geloven er sterk in dat pair programming de manier is om echt samen te werken met collega's
  • Werk remote, vanuit ons kantoor in Merelbeke of on-site bij klanten in West- en Oost-Vlaanderen
  • Streef naar kwaliteit en stabiliteit van je gemaakte front-end en/of back-end applicaties, hiervoor gebruik je graag TDD
  • Indien gewenst combineer je development met contact met de klant, team coaching, pre-sales, functionele en business analyse, data analytics, ...


Profiel


  • Veel goesting en goeie dosis humor
  • Bachelor of master diploma in een ICT-richting
  • Gedreven om wat nieuw is in onze dynamische software industrie te blijven bijleren
  • Je hebt reeds enkele jaren professionele ervaring in de Software Industrie
  • Ervaring met frameworks zoals Spring Boot, Vue.js is een troef
  • Voordeel als je kennis hebt van en/of ervaring hebt in: SQL, NoSQL, Docker, Gradle, Webpack, Reactive programming, …
  • Je communiceert vlot in het Nederlands en Engels

Title: React Native Developer
Description:
Job description

We are seeking a skilled and experienced React Native Developer to join our growing team at Mayten, a mobility technology company based in Brussels. In this role, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining our mobile applications using React Native. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality, user-friendly mobile experiences.




Responsibilities:

Develop and maintain mobile applications for shared micromobility using React Native
Collaborate with product managers, designers, and backend developers to deliver high-quality mobile experiences
Write clean, efficient, and reusable code
Troubleshoot and debug issues, and propose solutions to improve the performance and usability of the applications
Stay up to date with the latest trends and best practices in mobile development




Qualifications:

Strong proficiency in React Native and JavaScript with at least 3yrs of experience in React Native
Experience building mobile applications for iOS and Android platforms
Familiarity with native build tools, like Xcode, Android Studio, and Gradle
Understanding of RESTful APIs and integration of backend services
Knowledge of version control systems, such as Git
Excellent problem-solving and debugging skills




If you are a skilledReact Native Developer with a passion for delivering high-quality mobile experiences, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity at Mayten.

Title: Software Developer
Description:
About the company




ALTEN Belgium is a leading consultancy company in the fields of Engineering, Life Science and IT in which our people and clients are central.

In our open and adaptable organization, we get the best out of our ambitious employees enabling them to perform optimally. We do this by offering them the most challenging projects, but also to continuously acquire new expertise to boost their careers. This can be done with the help of our ALTEN Academy, but also through our knowledge sharing events.

All employees together form a large network of expertise, even at an international level. In this way we offer optimal growth to our consultants and the best solutions for our customers.




About the job




We are looking for motivated Software Developers to join our team of talented consultants working on challenging projects. As an ALTEN consultant, you will have the opportunity to be part of the following activities :




Analyze, document, and implement changes in the software modules
Create technical documentation for the software modules
Execute and document the test for the software modules
Analyze blueprint and understand customers' requirements
Discuss about workarounds when needed
Investigate on issues logged from the customer
Share experience and knowledge through weekly technical meetings
Document each customization made




About you




You have at least 2 years of experience in software development or software engineering
You have a Bachelors or Masters degree in engineering or IT, specialized in computer science, information technology, or equivalent
You are fluent in English and French or Dutch
You have proven experience in Java or C# (Object Oriented Programming languages)
You also have knowledge in some of these languages : Javascript, Spring boot, Hibernate, MySQL / PostgreSQL / SQL Server, AngularJs, NodeJs, Python, C, C++, Jenkins, Docker, Entity Framework, Linq
You have experience in, or knowledge of the Agile environment
You have analytical and problem-solving skills
You are a teamplayer, logical and organized




If you see yourself while reading these requirements, don't hesitate to apply, you might be our next software developer!

Title: NLP Data Scientist
Description:
About ARTIDIS

ARTIDIS AG is a clinical-stage health-tech start-up founded in Basel, Switzerland that has developed the first nanomechanical biomarker for cancer diagnosis and treatment optimization. The ARTIDIS nanotechnology platform integrates different types of clinical data into the ARTIDISNET digital platform, allowing physicians to significantly shorten the current diagnostic process and benefit both the patient and the healthcare system. ARTIDIS enables professionals to design personalized cancer treatment plans tailored to individual patients' needs and desired outcomes.

Job Purpose

ARTIDIS is changing the way cancer is diagnosed and treated. As a member of our team, you will have the opportunity to create products that will assist doctors, clinicians, nurses and patients in conducting clinical studies and providing better healthcare. An NLP Data Scientist at ARTIDIS is expected to communicate and understand customer requirements.

As an NLP Data Scientist, you’ll be tasked to develop, deploy, and NLP models on a medical device and in the cloud.

Duties And Responsibilities

Develop, productionize, maintain, and improve NLP pipelines and NLP models for PHI redaction and medical text extraction using classical text analytics and deep learning NLP techniques.

Qualifications


Strong programming skills in Python, especially in object-oriented programming (OOP).
Experience with the Python data stack (NumPy, pandas, scikit-learn, PyTorch).
Familiarity with NLP libraries (e.g., LangChain, Hugging Face).
Experience with classical NLP techniques (tokenization, part-of-speech tagging, named entity recognition, PII detection, Information extraction).
Writing documented, clear and efficient code.
Understanding how to use version control systems for code, data and models.
Ability to design and implement requirements with long-term objectives in mind.
High level of expression and comprehension of the English language.
Proactive way of thinking, communicating and working.
Ability to work independently.


Nice To Haves


Understanding of MLOps and putting pipelines into production (containerization, API creation)
Understanding regulations in the medical device and software fields (and their relevance to machine learning)
Experience with OCR libraries


Working Conditions

The environment is a typical start-up with an intrinsically motivated international team. Our company is an excellent place for rapid advancement and offers a promising opportunity to learn and share know-how in a very agile environment. The position requires the employee to go the extra mile when needed. We are looking for a team player who appreciates direct communication. The effort is rewarded with challenging tasks, the possibility to take responsibility, a highly driven team and work serving a significant purpose. The job position comes with a competitive salary and a bonus for outstanding performance.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist / Optimization Specialist
Description:
We are seeking a Data Scientist / Optimization Specialist to join our team. The ideal candidate will be an expert in optimization/operational-research and high-performance, with the ability to address complex business problems using mathematical optimization or machine learning techniques. They will play a crucial role in translating business challenges into mathematical optimization problems and then developing innovative computational solutions. We expect you to be autonomous and able to learn (methodologies, technologies, domains) and adapt to a fast-moving environment.




Key Responsibilities:

Identify and articulate business problems that can be addressed through optimization, by collaborating with cross-functional teams.
Develop and implement mathematical models to optimize business processes and decision-making.
Develop and implement computational efficient solutions.
When necessary, utilize high-performance computing infrastructures to analyze and solve optimization problems efficiently.
While not mandatory, familiarity with quantum computing is a plus, as the candidate should be capable of understanding and modeling problems in a compatible "canonic" form – to make the solutions quantum ready, when relevant.
While not mandatory, experience in insurance and/or financial services (on topics such as advanced pricing, underwriting, reserving, or reinsurance) will be considered highly valuable.







Qualifications:

Advanced degree in optimization, operational-research, mathematics, computer science, or a related field OR an actuarial degree.
Proven experience in applying optimization and operational research techniques to real-world business challenges.
Proficiency in programming languages such as C, C++ or Cuda, but also Python.
Flexibility and Growth Mindset: We are seeking individuals who thrive in a dynamic and evolving environment, where learning and embracing new challenges are essential. The ideal candidates should demonstrate a strong willingness to continuously expand their knowledge, adapt to new technologies, and take on diverse and evolving responsibilities.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.
Languages: English (mandatory) and French (appreciated).

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer - Decarbonising Real Estate - ₣110k + Shares - Brilliant Climate-Tech Start-Up - Hybrid




One of Europe's most innovative Climate-Tech Start-Ups (Winner of the 2024 Tech of the Year Award) has created groundbreaking technology to move beyond the era of dirty buildings and bring Net Zero Real Estate closer to reality.




We are looking for a tech-passionate & bright Machine Learning Engineer who wants to put their skills towards addressing climate change & making a big difference. A team of some of the brightest minds in Europe, from 9 different countries, we embrace a fantastic culture and truly value hard work.




We are a fast-growing startup with a mission to decarbonise real estate - with backing from world-leading Climate-Tech VC's and Innovation Endeavors (San Francisco – fund of former Google CEO Eric Schmidt).




What you'll do:




Participate in the enhancement of our decision-making models.
Create and design predictive models for constructing signals.
Conceive new methods for extracting and combining publicly accessible data. Guide the product's direction and data partnerships.
Devise innovative solutions to address our customers' issues.
Manage the entire development process: from specifications to production implementation. Work with colleagues on architecture, design, and code reviews.




Who we are seeking:




Highly Self-Motivated: You can efficiently and promptly carry out tasks, demonstrating strong initiative and self-drive.
You Get Things Done: You prioritize speed and flexibility, adept at making swift compromises to maintain momentum, while delivering quality results.
Lateral thinker: You regularly step back to look at the broader picture. Changing the problem is sometimes faster and better than investing two weeks in a fancy ML model.
Analytical and Self-Reflective: You analyze your performance and continuously seek ways to improve.
Compassionate and Humorous: You bring kindness and humor to the team, enhancing both morale and collaboration.




Essential requirements:




MSc in Computer Science, Math, Physics or equivalent.
Broad algorithmic knowledge: dynamic programming, graphs algorithms, data structures, etc.
Broad ML knowledge: convex optimization, supervised learning, unsupervised learning, etc. Outstanding programming skills (Python, C++, C).
Ability to contribute individually and in teams.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.
Swiss or EU citizenship (unfortunately due to size, we can’t support non-EU).




Desirable qualifications




2+ years of professional experience in software development or data science.
Broad financial/real estate knowledge.
Experience with cloud products (GCP or AWS).




Benefits:




Significant impact on the product and strategy from the start.
Continuous learning opportunities in a growth-focused culture.
CHF 1k learning and development budget for conferences and certifications.
100% coverage of non-occupational accident insurance (UVG).
25 days of paid vacation and flexible parental leave.
Mainly based in our Zürich office, with some remote work and flexible hours available.




Venchr is an equal-opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy, race, religion or belief, sex, or sexual orientation. All applicants will receive consideration for employment based on their talent, skillset and individual merit alone.

Title: Deep Learning Engineer
Description:
Our client is an international group active in several areas, including power production and trading, renewable energy sources, electricity supply products. With the support from Open Search Network they are looking to hire on a permanent basis:




Deep Learning Engineer

(Lugano, Switzerland)




Company: End User / Energy

Experience: 3+ years working experience

Skills: Python, Machine Learning, NLP







Tasks




Develop, implement, and optimize cutting-edge deep learning models for various applications, including computer vision, natural language processing, and more
Seamlessly integrate open-source deep learning models and libraries into your projects
Utilize transfer learning and fine-tuning techniques to effectively leverage pre-trained models
Deploy models into production environments, ensuring scalability and peak efficiency
Proactively scout and evaluate emerging technologies that can be leveraged within the company's operations
Dedicate a portion of your work to general data science tasks and projects




Qualifications




A Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, or a related field
Demonstrated expertise in developing and optimizing deep learning models
Hands-on experience with open-source deep learning frameworks and libraries, such as TensorFlow and PyTorch
Proficiency in Python and data science libraries, including pandas and scikit-learn
Strong familiarity with computer vision and/or natural language processing techniques
A deep understanding of transfer learning and the ability to apply it effectively
Proficiency in data science and statistics




Nice to have




Familiarity with deep reinforcement learning
Experience handling structured and unstructured data, data pipelines, ETL and data organization in databases, data warehouses, data lakes
Previous publications or notable contributions to the field of deep learning
Familiarity with cloud-based tools and services for model deployment and management

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist (M/F/D)

Tasks:

Ensure that scientific teams are enabled and supported to achieve their goals at data42
Contributes to the acceleration of data science through activities such as the development of reusable pipelines for the data preparation and analyses
Develops frameworks for generation and reporting of key results, quality benchmarks for data, models, and impact in collaboration with our data scientist users.
Applies their expertise in machine learning, deep learning, data visualization and structured/unstructured data analytics towards the scientific goals of their team.
Acts as an advocate for good data science practice across data42
Ensure that scientific teams are enabled and supported to achieve their goals at data42
Contributes to the acceleration of data science through activities such as the development of reusable pipelines for the data preparation and analyses
Develops frameworks for generation and reporting of key results, quality benchmarks for data, models, and impact in collaboration with our data scientist users.
Applies their expertise in machine learning, deep learning, data visualization and structured/unstructured data analytics towards the scientific goals of their team.
Acts as an advocate for good data science practice across data42

Qualification:

PhD in a quantitative / computational science (e.g. bioinformatics, engineering, machine learning, statistics, physics, mathematics, ...)
Languages: Fluent in English (oral and written)
At least 2 years of professional experience in the pharmaceutical sector
Experience with bioinformatics (around DNA / RNA / proteomics data analysis) and/or statistical genetics and/or biostatistics
Strong experience with R or python for data analysis and statistical modelling
Experience in using machine learning models to predict clinical endpoints using multimodal data
Experience with use of AI/GenAI/LLMs for automating or accelerating data- or data science related processes
Experience with the principles and tools of good data science practice (e.g git/versioning …).
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
Desirable additional skills in two or more of the following areas:
Knowledge of CDISC data standard (SDTM, ADaM),
Experience with pooling of clinical trial data
Understanding of the drug discovery and development process
Experience working in the field of Immunology or Cardiology/Renal/Metabolic diseases
Experience with computational environments for large-scale data science (e.g. high-performance computing or Spark),
Statistical and machine learning, and / or applied deep learning methods for time series data.
Experience in using the Foundry platform for data analysis

Requirements:

Start: 01.08.2024

Duration: 5 months

Capacity: 5 days per week

Location: Basel, Switzerland

Title: Trading Data Scientist
Description:
Profil du candidat


You are a master’s degree holder
You are a Digital native with strong analytical, quantitative and computing kills: data analytics, AI/machine learning, cloud computing, Power BI, Alteryx, R, Python, MongoDb …
You have a previous experience in commodity trading or in the energy industry.
You can work well in a team, but also autonomously and have strong communication skills, and the ability to convince.
English essential, other languages such as French are a strong advantage.
Location: Geneva
Desired start date: Q4 2024



At TotalEnergies, we believe that our employees’ fulfilment has its roots in the wealth of the experiences they are offered. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to respecting diversity and inclusion in the workplace.

Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard for race, color, gender, religion, national origin, disability, military status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any other protected group status.

Activités

What You Will Do

As a member of the Digital Transformation & innovation Team, you will be in charge of:


Contributing to the digital and data strategy of TGP for Gas, Power and LNG Trading
Leveraging digital tools and technologies for the implementation of innovative solutions in order to create business value
Developing the digital projects portfolio of TGP
Participating to Incorporate agile ways of working to accelerate transformations
Promoting digital innovation and data culture in the organisation
Contributing to practice development initiatives including internal community development (e.g Data Scientist network)
Supporting the teams across the organization and locations in implementing disruptive models and assist in change management activities



Contexte et environnement

Are you looking to grow your career in the vibrant world of Digital Transformation & Innovation?

Do you have a background related to Digital, with strong analytical, quant and computing skills? If yes, we would love to see your profile !

Context and environment

The Trading Division is responsible for the development and the management of a portfolio of commercial outlets for natural gas, natural gas liquids, shale gas, liquefied natural gas, power, emissions certificates, and dry bulk products in Europe, the United States and Asia.

The fast-paced trading environment requires you to work autonomously and within the team.

This position requires daily interactions with other departments within the organization notably Front Office, Market Research, Middle Office, Back Office, Finance and Compliance. Industry and contractual deadlines must be met requiring a good ability to plan and work under time pressure.

Our Culture

We are committed to meet the energy needs of a growing population and we are committed to the energy transition. The volatility of the energy trading markets requires excellence in risk management and a culture of innovation. We are fully embracing the digital revolution.

Our people flourish in an environment that promotes expertise, entrepreneurship spirit, agility and a purpose-driven culture, generating boundless opportunities to learn, grow and achieve collaborative success.

Reinforcing the competencies of our people is a key pillar of our culture: we train our people to ensure their development and we pledge to encourage safety in all our actions.

We look for passion, ambition and open-mindedness. While we evolve in a demanding industry that requests to be always on the edge, we cultivate a friendly workplace where our people feel good, where team spirit and respect guide our daily routine, where the diversity of our people and their skills create a nourishing experience for all of us.
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Hey there, future innovator! At Creaitor we’re reshaping the way companies manage their content marketing. Since 2022 we’ve been building the leading AI-driven platform to help businesses streamline their entire content marketing lifecycle. We’re at home in beautiful Lucerne, Switzerland but our growing team mostly works remotly to build amazing AI solutions for customers all over the world.

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Lead Machine Learning Engineer to spearhead our machine learning initiatives working directly with Creaitor's CTO. This role is critical as you will lay the foundation for our ML/AI capabilities and lead the development of innovative solutions that enhance our platform. You will cover both the roles of a Machine Learning Engineer and a Data Scientist, working closely with product managers to build and deploy cutting-edge models that meet the needs of our customers.

Tasks


Lead ML Development: Design, develop, and deploy machine learning models.
Strategy and Vision: Develop and execute a strategic roadmap for machine learning initiatives aligned with Creaitor’s goals.
Cross-functional Collaboration: Work with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities for leveraging machine learning to solve complex problems and improve user experience.
Vector Database Management: Set up and manage vector databases to efficiently store and retrieve high-dimensional data, enabling fast and accurate similarity searches.
Data Management: Collect, preprocess, and analyze large datasets to inform model development and extract actionable insights.
Feature Engineering: Perform feature engineering to enhance model performance and accuracy.
Model Training: Train and fine-tune machine learning models using state-of-the-art techniques.
Model Optimization: Evaluate and optimize model performance to ensure accuracy, efficiency, and scalability.
Research and Innovation: Stay up-to-date with the latest research and advancements in machine learning and AI to continuously enhance our platform.
Testing and Maintenance: Implement and maintain robust testing frameworks to ensure the reliability of machine learning solutions.
Documentation: Document processes, models, and methodologies to ensure knowledge sharing and reproducibility.



Requirements


Education: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, or a related field.
Experience: Proven experience as a Machine Learning Engineer or similar role, with a strong portfolio of successful projects.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or similar. Experience with machine learning frameworks and libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn, etc.
Foundational Knowledge: Strong understanding of data structures, algorithms, and software engineering principles.
LLM Expertise: Experience in developing AI/ML solutions with a focus on LLM and LLM frameworks (e.g. LangChain). Strong knowledge and practical experience in Generative AI
NLP Expertise: Knowledge of natural language processing (NLP) techniques and tools.
Vector Databases: Experience in working with vector databases (e.g., Pinecone, FAISS, Milvus) to store and manage high-dimensional data for similarity searches and recommendation engines.
Cloud Experience: Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure) and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes) is a plus.
Leadership: Demonstrated ability to lead projects and work independently as well as part of a team.
Communication Skills: Strong communication skills and the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.



Benefits


Work remotely while being an indispensable member of our global team. You’ll have all the tools at your disposal to fascilitae communication and a great work environment.
Work at the heart of a growing AI startup with a unique culture and ambitions to match your own.
We are result driven and give you the space and flexibility to organize your work as it best suits you.
Get the opportunity to be a co-owner of a successfull startup with Creaitor’s Employee Stock Options Program.
Be part of the initial scaling team and shape the future of Creaitor with us



We’re fresh off of closing our pre-seed financing round and are ready to kick our growth into high gear by welcoming new team members with exceptional talent to grow Creaitor to the preferred AI Content Marketing platform for businesses worldwide. If this sounds exciting to you, apply now!
Show more

Title: Principal Data Scientist (w/m/d) 100% Switzerland
Description:
Luware is still incredibly growing! Since our foundation in 2010, we have been getting the most out of the Microsoft technology stack and continuously improving it. Our unique solutions transform Microsoft Teams into a customer service hub that gives meaning to every customer interaction. As the leading software-as-a-service company in our market segment, agile, hybrid working is a matter of course for us.




We are looking for as soon as possible for a Principal Data Scientist, as additional support for our outstanding Development Team in Switzerland/ Zürich (remote). In this very interesting role, you will be able to actively shape our product and integrate your ideas and thereby contribute to the success of Luware.




As a Principal Data Scientist in the Luware Nimbus Application team, you will work with business and AI leaders as well as internal business users and Partners to understand, explore and develop AI/ML solutions to solve their business needs.




We innovate and collaborate closely with our partners and customers in a very agile environment. Take the opportunity to collaborate with a diverse team on enabling end-to-end business scenarios using cutting-edge AI technologies and to solve challenging problems for large scale 24x7 business SaaS applications!




Your responsibilities




Develop, deploy and monitor scalable data pipelines that ingest and process data from multi-tenant production environments to research environments using C#/Spark/Synapse
Develop, deploy and monitor data enrichment workflows including dataset creation, cataloging and reporting
Develop and deploy tooling that ensures compliance with data governance and life cycle management requirements and best practices
Detect, monitor, and resolve data quality issues in collaboration with other teams
Implement tools and data architecture improvements that increase data usability and quality.
Focus on particular aspects of our product, developing extensive knowledge in the domain and technical framework, notably in Large Language Models (LLM), and play a role in advancing product development through ongoing awareness of industry trends and technologies
Assess business needs and integrate research to achieve business objectives
Your role involves guiding the selection of data to address issues strategically, leveraging your expertise to design, measure and build AI applications to drive tangible business results.
You'll be involved in the onboarding process for new team members early in their careers, providing guidance and support as they join the team, and also assisting in coaching and mentoring other team members
Cultivate a supportive and inclusive team culture, offering technical guidance to fellow team members and serving as a mentor




Your skills




Degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research, Computer Science, or related field AND 7+ year(s) data-science experience (e.g., managing structured and unstructured data, applying statistical techniques and reporting results)
Hands on coding experience in an object-oriented language (such as C#)
OR equivalent experience.
Multi-year technical experience working with relational databases and query languages
Previous experience managing software DevOps (especially ADO pipelines), building infrastructure using Microsoft Azure technology like Service Fabric, App Service, Docker
Experience with Azure ecosystem including cross tenants and highly restricted environments, as well as developing scalable processing using Spark especially in Azure will be considered strong assets
Experience complying with data governance and compliance standards such as GDPR or HIPAA within restricted environments
Experience developing and deploying dashboards (especially in Power BI)
Experience with design and implementation of enterprise-scale services
Experience in developing, debugging, and supporting code in object-oriented languages and database querying languages.
Experience in developing and debugging product and test code within a micro-services architecture




Our Offer




Challenging, interesting work in a varied field with a high level of personal responsibility
A dynamic, motivating working environment that leaves room for the realisation of your ideas and promotes your personal development
Regular team events and the opportunity to work in one of the Luware offices for up to one month as part of our exchange programme




You can expect an extremely collegial, international environment and a fresh, dynamic, open corporate culture, let the Luware spirit convince you!




Do you feel addressed and are you ready to finally unleash your full potential? Then send us your spontaneous application over the Applicants- Button!




We are very looking forward to getting to know you!




For this role, we do not consider and processing any applications from staffing agencies, thank you for your understanding.




A Bit About Us

Since our foundation in 2010, our goal has been to empower organizations to communicate more effectively. We offer calling, contact center, and recording solutions that transform Microsoft Teams into a customer experience hub and help organizations to create value in every customer interaction. We are a young and international team spread out across Switzerland, Germany, the United Kingdom, Poland, and the USA. Because of this, we often rely on Teams to keep in touch but we make sure to come together when we can. We enjoy meeting up for after-work drinks and activities.

Show more

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
ParetoLabs is looking for a dedicated and passionate AI Engineer to join our dynamic and growing team. If you have a strong command of AI and Machine Learning methodologies, you'll play a significant role in shaping the AI-driven solutions we deliver across various industries.

About ParetoLabs

ParetoLabs is a software studio that develops customized, AI-powered applications for conversation and text processing. The startup helps customers quickly test AI applications in their context. Founded in Zurich, the "Microsoft for Startups" partner has been bringing together the most innovative AI technologies with the specific needs of Swiss companies since 2023.

Aufgaben


Analyze Customer Needs: Understand and conceptualize the solution architecture based on customer requirements.
Implement Solutions: Develop the solution architecture using Python, appropriate libraries, and Azure AI components.
Model Development: Select, train, and validate suitable machine learning models.
Integration and Quality Measurement: Integrate trained models into the solution architecture and measure their quality.
Consulting Expertise: Serve as an important point of contact for colleagues in consulting with your AI/ML expertise.
Community Involvement: Actively participate in the Data + ML community and contribute to the development of our offerings.



Qualifikation


Educational Background: Completed training or a degree in Data Science, ML, AI, Computer Science, Business Informatics, Physics, Statistics, or a related field.
Proven Experience: Practical experience in AI/ML projects.
Technical Skills: Practical experience as a developer with Python in the areas of Data Science, Machine Learning, or AI.
Advantageous Skills: Familiarity with LLMs and/or RAG systems. Experience with Azure ML and Azure AI Services. Knowledge and experience with ML Ops.



Benefits


Competitive Remuneration: A competitive salary package, reflecting your experience and contributions.
Flexible Work Arrangements: Choose from remote, on-site, or hybrid working models, with a preference for candidates based in Switzerland.
Pick Your Gear: Choose your preferred devices for work.
Attractive Benefits: above market pension benefits and a private accident insurance.
Professional Growth: Participation in the Microsoft for Startups program, offering access to valuable resources, events and support.



If you're passionate about AI Engineering and eager to make an impact on the AI application landscape, we invite you to apply to ParetoLabs. Please send your resume and portfolio showcasing your relevant experience (GitHub link preferred).

Join us in our mission to deliver cutting-edge AI solutions and shape the future of technology across industries!
