Title: Machine Learning Engineer (Edge) in a fast-growing AI Startup
Description:
At the ETH spin-off Lightly, we build software solutions to help companies improve their deep learning models. The available data for deep learning grows faster than human tagging and available compute power. Our customers already face this problem and have too much data to process. As a solution, we built software to identify and work with the most relevant samples only. Learn more about us on our website.

We are a team of talented developers and researchers in Zurich, Prague and San Francisco and are backed by YCombinator. Every member of the team is going to have a massive impact.

Thus, we are looking for an experienced engineer with lots of passion for the subject. We offer attractive cash- & equity package for you to become part-owner of Lightly. Remote work is also possible.

We use a modern stack of:


PyTorch, Python, Typescript, C++, Rust, React, NodeJS
Docker, Kubernetes, Google Cloud Platform, AWS



Tasks

As a Machine Learning Engineer you will contribute to train and optimise state-of-the-art computer vision models to run on various hardware for real-time applications.

Particularly, you will get to:


Design, train, and improve machine learning models for embedded devices, considering platform limitations.
Develop frameworks to evaluate and iterate on machine learning models.
Keep up with current research in self-supervised learning and multi-modal models.
Contribute to our product codebase written in Rust, C++, and Python.
Work with state-of-the-art technology such as self-supervised learning, model distillation, vision-language models, and deep learning for computer vision.
Participate in and hold paper sessions about the latest papers in the field.



Requirements

Ideally, you have:


MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
At least 2 years of industry experience in deep learning and computer vision, with experience in PyTorch.
Proficiency in Python.
Willingness to learn Rust and C++. Willingness to learn software engineering best practices to contribute to our product codebase. Previous experience is a plus.
Strong passion for new technologies and interest in keeping up with the latest technologies and publications in deep learning.
A creative, collaborative, and product-focused mindset.



Benefits

We offer attractive cash- & equity package for you to become part-owner of Lightly. Remote work is also possible.

Interested? Contact us!

We look forward to getting to know you!
Show more

Title: Python Developer
Description:
We are in search of a Python Developer for our client in the Geneva area.




In this role, you will enhance and maintain the backend code, resolve performance issues, create web services, and implement various backend modules.




If you have extensive knowledge of Python, Flask, and MongoDB, along with several years of practical experience, and are fluent in English, this opportunity is ideal for you!




Experience with Django, MariaDB, Elasticsearch, as well as Docker, and Kubernetes is an advantage.




If you are interested in this role, please apply directly to bojana.bandovic@nicollcurtin.com.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
VF Corporation is looking for an exceptional Data Scientist to join our Data Science team based in Stabio, Switzerland.




Let’s talk about the role!




As a Data Scientist at VF Corporation, you’ll play a crucial role in transforming data into actionable insights. You’ll work on challenging problems, collaborate with cross-functional teams, and drive data-driven decision-making for all the functions and brands of VF Corporation.




We expect that you will deliver unbeatable results whilst fulfilling the following aspects of the Data Scientist role:




Develop predicting models in the area of DTC marketing.
Develop models in the area of supply and demand chain.
Monitor and maintain the already deployed models to ensure that the performances remain outstanding.
Present the results to our internal stakeholders.
Have a continuous dialogue with Data Engineers and DevOps to drive new development in the area of model productionalization.




Skills For Success

A successful Data Scientist will be able to bring his contribution in the whole Data Science development chain.




Starting from capturing the right request from the business stakeholders, talking with Data Engineers to retrieve the right data, developing the best model, and presenting the results to the Data Science management and to stakeholders.




Technical Skills:

Python Proficiency: demonstrated ability to write efficient, clean Python code for data manipulation, analysis, and modeling.
Data Science and Machine Learning: strong understanding of core ML concepts (clustering, classification, regression, dimensionality reduction).
Time Series Forecasting: extensive experience with time series forecasting methods (statistical, ML, and DL).
Deep Learning and Generative AI: knowledge of main neural network topologies for computer vision and natural language modeling (CNNs, RNNs, autoencoders, transformers, LLMs, diffusion models, RAG, etc.).
Hyperparameter Optimization: Familiarity with best practices (e.g., Bayesian optimization).
Statistical Analysis: Solid grasp of hypothesis testing, A/B testing, and statistical modeling.
Querying and DBs: Deep knowledge of SQL; familiarity with other languages is a plus.
Nice to have: knowledge of recommender systems.




Tools and Platforms:

Version Control: Proficiency with Git for version control and collaboration.
AWS Ecosystem: Experience with AWS services (e.g., Sagemaker, Redshift, Bedrock) is a plus.
Data Visualization: Familiarity with PowerBI or Tableau for presenting project results.




Soft Skills:

Adaptability: Ability to react swiftly to changes and adapt to evolving requirements.
Self-Organization: Strong organizational skills to manage tasks effectively and meet deadlines.
Teamwork: Positive, proactive attitude toward collaboration.
Communication: Fluency in English. Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Experience: Minimum 5 years of relevant experience in a similar role.
Experience in retail will be considered as a plus.




VF is a global apparel company connecting people to the lifestyles they cherish through our family of iconic brands. At the heart of our journey lies our purpose: We power movements of sustainable and active lifestyles for the betterment of people and our planet. This is our purpose. It’s the reason we come to work every day. Our purpose unites us and leads us to pursue our goals, together. This is our calling. Learn more at vfc.com




What’s In It For You

We’re in the business of unleashing human potential, driven by the ideas, energy and commitment of our people. That’s why we offer comprehensive benefits that encourage mental, physical and financial well-being for all VF associates. When it comes to benefits, we’re the total package.




A supportive feedback-based culture where respect and integrity guide us in what we do
An inclusive international environment where people of diverse backgrounds, lifestyles and nationalities love working together
Be part of an iconic lifestyle brand in a multi brand, multi countries organization
On site gym offering health and well-being initiatives
A discount card with 50% on all VF brands
Break out areas offering complimentary hot drinks




This post is eligible for relocation support.




Free to Be, Inclusion & Diversity

As a purpose-led, performance driven company, we strive to foster a culture of belonging based on respect, connection, openness and authenticity. We are committed to building and maintaining a workplace that celebrates the diversity of our associates, allowing them to bring their authentic selves to work every day.




As an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer, VF is committed to support disadvantaged groups whilst providing equal opportunities for both VF associates and applicants alike.




If you like what you have read and want to join our team then we would like to hear from you!




R-20240724-0031

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
JOB PURPOSE

Are you passionate about uncovering insights from data and driving innovative solutions? Do you excel at solving complex problems and developing advanced models? If so, we have the perfect opportunity for you!

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Data Scientist to join our dynamic Revenue Management team. In this role, you'll harness your expertise in data analysis, statistical modeling, and machine learning to optimise our revenue strategies.


KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES

• Analyse large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for revenue growth.

• Develop and implement predictive models to forecast demand and optimise pricing strategies.

• Apply time series analysis and machine learning theory to improve demand forecasting and inventory management.

• Manage and improve interactive web applications for data visualisation.

• Perform web scraping to gather external data relevant to revenue management.

• Generate actionable insights from data analysis to support decision-making processes.

• Present findings and recommendations in a clear and concise manner.

• Review and document code to ensure clarity, maintainability, and best practices.

• Stay current with industry trends and advancements in data science methodologies.


QUALIFICATIONS

• Master's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field.

• Proven experience as a Data Scientist, preferably in the travel, hospitality, or related industries.

• Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and SQL.

• Experience with TensorFlow, Keras, Streamlit, Prophet.

• Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets.

• Knowledge of machine learning techniques and algorithms, and time series analysis.

• Excellent communication and presentation skills.

• Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.

• Knowledge of web scraping techniques and tools.

• Proven capability to industrialise models and implement solutions into production environments.

• Experience with deploying applications and models using Docker, Jenkins, and other similar tools.

• Strong skills in ETL processes and data architecture.


VISA REQUIREMENTS

EU Passport or Right to work in Switzerland.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (OSS) in a fast-growing AI Startup
Description:
At the ETH spin-off Lightly, we build software solutions to help companies improve their deep learning models. The available data for deep learning grows faster than human tagging and available compute power. Our customers already face this problem and have too much data to process. As a solution, we built software to identify and work with the most relevant samples only. Learn more about us on our website.

We are a team of talented developers and researchers in Zurich, Prague and San Francisco and are backed by YCombinator. Every member of the team is going to have a massive impact.

Thus, we are looking for an experienced engineer with lots of passion for the subject. We offer attractive cash- & equity package for you to become part-owner of Lightly. Remote work is also possible.

We use a modern stack of:


PyTorch, Python, Typescript, C++, Rust, React, NodeJS
Docker, Kubernetes, Google Cloud Platform, AWS



Tasks

As a Machine Learning Engineer in the core ML team, you will be part of a team which works mainly on our open-source package for self-supervised learning and similar internal frameworks.

Particularly, you will get to:


Work on our open-source Python package for self-supervised learning: https://github.com/lightly-ai/lightly.
Add support for finetuning pretrained models for downstream tasks including many different computer vision tasks like object detection, segmentation, tracking, and more.
Keep up with current research in self-supervised learning and multi-modal models.
All these tasks will include working with state-of-the-art technology such as self-supervised learning, model distillation, vision language models and deep learning for computer vision in general.
Participate in and hold paper sessions about the latest papers in the field.
Represent the company at machine learning conferences and engage with the community.



In general, for this role expect to use the stack we use for our open-source package https://github.com/lightly-ai/lightly.

Requirements

Ideally, you have:


MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
Experience in deep learning and computer vision, ideally in self-supervised learning and you have worked with PyTorch.
Excellent Python coding skills and knowledge of software engineering best practices. Experience with testing and typed Python is a big plus.
Experience with building and shipping software solutions.
Strong passion for new technologies and interest in keeping up with the latest technologies and publications in deep learning.



Benefits

We offer attractive cash- & equity package for you to become part-owner of Lightly. Remote work is also possible.

Interested? Contact us!

We look forward to getting to know you!

Title: Research Engineer
Description:
We are on a mission to unlock the power of agentic AI systems by making them secure, trustworthy and reliable.

Our team: Our dedicated and fast-moving team consists of leading AI and security researchers, repeat founders, creators of popular open-source projects, Olympiad gold medalists, and cybersecurity experts. We blend the unique experience at top research institutions such as ETH Zurich, Stanford, and the University of Cambridge and industry leaders such as Facebook, Twitter, Google Brain, Snyk and Adobe.

Who are we looking for: We are assembling a team of top engineers, researchers and builders who can learn and execute quickly and are not afraid to dive deep into cutting-edge products and research. If this sounds like you, we offer an opportunity to make a significant impact both within our company and on the world at large as we tackle together some of the most difficult challenges in AI.

Title: Postdoctoral Scientist - AI/ML Bioimage Analysis
Description:
Johnson & Johnson Innovative Medicine R&D Data Science & Digital Health organization is recruiting for a Postdoctoral Scientist – AI/ML Bioimage Analysis to join the Data Science Analytics & Insights team to help advance AI/ML Analytics for Drug Discovery.

This is a 2 year fixed term contract.




The primary location for this position is Zug, Switzerland but exceptionally skilled candidates may be considered for remote work from Belgium, Germany, UK and the USA, with up to 10% travel.




With $85.2 billion in consolidated sales for 2023, Johnson & Johnson is the world's most comprehensive and broadly based manufacturer of health care products, as well as a provider of related services, for the consumer, pharmaceutical, and medical devices and diagnostics markets. There are more than 250 Johnson & Johnson operating companies employing approximately 130,000 people in 60 countries throughout the world.

The Data Science Analytics & Insights team develops innovative solutions using a variety of data sources across multiple different disease areas, encompassing oncology, cardiovascular and metabolic disorders, immunology, neuroscience, and infectious disease. We are looking for a highly motivated and innovative Postdoctoral Fellow who will work at the intersection of AI/ML, Computer Vision/Bioimaging, Multi-task Prediction and Molecule Design.




Key responsibilities:

Conceive, develop, and implement AI/ML solutions applied to drug discovery problems, including but not limited to, processing and analysis of large-scale imaging and assay data (e.g. high content imaging, cryogenic electron microscopy, tissue imaging, and medical imaging), molecule property predictions, and AI-based optimization
Contribute to design of analysis plan and technical execution of a project, and execute end-to-end analyses, including progress reports and high-quality code documentation
Work closely with a cross disciplinary team of data and AI scientists, imaging experts, biologists, and computational chemists, and leverages cross-domain expertise to contribute to a rigorous scientific evidence package strategically aligned with molecule development cycle
Extensive hands-on coding and actively contribute to platform development
Document and disseminate research findings internally and externally (e.g.- publishing in top-tier ML conferences/journals)




Qualifications:

Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering /Biomedical Engineering/Computer Science/Applied Mathematics or related majors
Strong technical expertise in AI / deep learning with excellent analytical skills in at least one domain area with proven track records (publication in top-tier journals, awards, patents, white papers)
Extensive, hands-on experience in AI/ML in related applications such as High-dimensional biomedical imaging/ Computer Vision/ Omics Analysis/ AI-based Drug Design/ and other related field.
Proficiency with one or more programming language, preferably Python. Proficiency in one or more AI framework such as Pytorch or Tensorflow
Good communication skills an able to present analytical results on behalf of the project team in a cross-functional setting, contextualizing how it fits within the broader project




Benefits: Employees may be eligible to participate in Company employee benefit programs such as health insurance, savings plan, pension plan, disability plan, vacation pay, sick time, holiday pay, and work, personal and family time off in accordance with the terms of the applicable plans. For additional general information on company benefits, please go to: https://www.careers.jnj.com/employee-benefits




At Johnson & Johnson, we’re on a mission to change the trajectory of health for humanity. That starts by creating the world’s healthiest workforce. Through cutting-edge programs and policies, we empower the physical, mental, emotional and financial health of our employees and the ones they love. As such, candidates offered employment must show proof of COVID-19 vaccination or secure an approved accommodation prior to the commencement of employment to support the well-being of our employees, their families and the communities in which we live and work.

Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
LocationBasel, SwitzerlandBusiness SectorAIContact emailJob ref23545Published5 days ago

We are seeking a talented Machine Learning Engineer to join one of our clients in MedTech. In this role you will be responsible for designing, developing, and deploying machine learning models to drive innovation in healthcare solutions. You will work closely with data scientists, software engineers, and clinicians to integrate machine learning into real-world applications that impact patient care.

Responsibilities


Develop and implement machine learning algorithms to solve complex healthcare problems.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and integrate machine learning models into production systems.
Work with large datasets to train, validate, and optimize machine learning models.
Enhance model performance through techniques such as feature engineering, hyperparameter tuning, and algorithm optimization.
Ensure scalability, reliability, and security of deployed models in a healthcare environment.



Qualifications


Proven experience in machine learning and data science, within the MedTech sector.
Proficiency in Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar frameworks.
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and data processing tools.
Strong understanding of statistical analysis, data modeling, and machine learning algorithms.
Excellent problem-solving skills and a team-oriented mindset.
Professional proficiency in English.



Can this be interesting for you or anyone you know? If so, please send Gabriel Andrade: g.andrade@panda-int.com, your number/CV ASAP and I'll give you a call. Interviews will start next week.

We are working with one of our largest Energy Trading clients who are looking for Python Developer to join their European front office trading team.

Strong Python skills

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
For our locations in Lausanne (preferably) or Geneva, we are looking for an experienced Data Scientist.

In order to further strengthen our Data Science team, we offer a diversified and interesting job to a person with motivation, initiative and good sense of service quality provided to our customers.




In this role

As a ML engineer, you will be part of a consultants’ team to deliver services, mandates and or projects dealing with artificial intelligence, Machine Learning issues in increasingly ambitious customer context. In your role you will be involved in:

• Realization of data science/ML/AI projects (data sources ingestion, data processing, Modeling, tests, deployments)

• Optimization and industrialization of machine learning and artificial intelligence models.

• Understanding customer needs in order to offer solutions in line with their expectations

• Project documentation (design, production, deployment, etc.),

• Managing the evolutions of the proposed solutions, and possibly ensure their maintenance.

• Technological monitoring and follow-up of the main market developments




What we offer

• A key role in a multidisciplinary service company, a leader in Switzerland in the field of new technologies

• A pleasant working environment in a young and motivated team

• Coaching by our Data Science experts and managers

• Attractive development opportunities in various technological fields with further responsibilities

• A wide range of exciting and interesting projects in various industry




About your profile

For this vacancy we expect a candidate with a master's degree of a university, university of applied sciences or technical college with at least two-years hands-on experience plus a significant internship.

• Strong skills in machine learning algorithms

• Knowledge in NLP and text classification and a good understanding of LLMs

• Knowledge in various programming languages (Python, PySpark, Scala…)

• Comfortable with CI/CD or MLOps concept

• Knowledge of Microsoft Azure platform and/or AWS is a strong plus.




Other skills:

• Flexibility to travel around Switzerland

• Curious and willing to learn

• Speaking german is a strong plus

• Your strengths include an efficient style of working in a team, a distinct customer focus and very good communication skills.

Title: Data Science Internship (6 months)
Description:
CT_Technology & Innovation-E122

Data Science Internship (6 months) - Full Time - Oberwinterthur, Switzerland

Sulzer is a leading engineering company with a proud heritage of innovation. Join our global team to grow your expertise and develop innovative solutions that enable a prosperous and more sustainable society.

We are looking for a Data Science Trainee for 6 months to join our Technology and Innovation team in the Research and Development function in Oberwinterthur, Switzerland.

You will be part of our R&D organization and experience the development of new products from the ideation phase to market-ready products for our Separation Technology business unit. The focus for this position will be on our digitalization initiative. You will work with a dynamic and innovative team to support data-driven product development.

Your main tasks and responsibilities:


Building workflows to capture and structure data from our pilot plants and production facilities.
Statistical and machine-learning-assisted analyses of the data to identify critical parameters and optimize product development.
Implement new analytical technologies to further enhance our digitalization efforts.


To succeed in this role, you will need:


We look for excellent students in Chemical, Process or Mechanical Engineering (or related fields).
Strong data science experience in areas including statistical modeling, data mining, data visualization and data-driven analyses.
Proficiency in a programming language such as Python or R.
Knowledge of databases and data pipelines.
Demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft Office is expected.
Ability to co-ordinate and prioritize various tasks.
Driven, innovative and curious mindset.


What we offer you:


25 days holiday (exclusive of bank holidays)
Defined contribution pension scheme
Employee Assistance Program/health care
On-site car parking/public transport allowance
Access to a wide range of discounts


No visa or work permit support can be provided for this role.

To complete your application, we kindly ask you to include your CV and other supporting documentation, such as academic transcripts, and, if available, written references.

Sulzer is an equal opportunity employer. We believe in the strength of a diverse workforce and are committed to offering an inclusive work environment.

We are proud to be recognized as a Top Employer 2024 in Brazil, China, Germany, Switzerland, the United Kingdom and the United States.

Title: AI Researcher (LLM) - (100% remote - Switzerland)
Description:
At Tether, we're committed to making advanced AI technologies more accessible. Thanks to its investment in AI infrastructure, starting from Northern Data, Tether is now in a prime position to tackle ambitious AI projects. Our goal is to build the next generation of AI models, leading innovation in AI, through an accessible, transparent and privacy preserving approach.

The role involves building AI solutions across the spectrum from large-scale models designed for advanced applications to smaller, highly performant models tailored for efficiency on edge devices such as mobile phones and laptops.

Our dynamic team operates entirely remotely, uniting talent from every corner of the globe. Our journey has been marked by rapid growth and efficient operations, firmly establishing us as pioneers within the industry. Join us in building AI models and solutions that not only compete with but exceed the capabilities of current leaders, driving both technological advancement and broad accessibility.

What You'll Do:


Research and Development of multimodal AI models that set new industry standards.
Collaborate with other departments to ensure our AI models are effectively integrated into market-driven solutions.
A degree in Computer Science. Ideally PhD in NLP, Machine Learning, or a related field, complemented by a solid track record in AI R&D(with good publications in A* conferences).
Experience building a LLM or other large models from scratch including writing model code, gathering training data, optimizing training and inference.
Strong experience in NLP, multimodal learning, proficient in TensorFlow, PyTorch, JAX and CUDA toolkit.
Excellent programming skills in Python.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientists at QuantCo will learn what it takes to create impact from data: identifying the right framework to translate a business question into a statistical problem; locating and combining data sources as well as transforming large datasets; running in-depth analyses; building machine learning models that automate large-scale decisions and integrating them into live business processes; and interpreting, visualizing, and communicating results to internal and external stakeholders.

We are looking for team players who have excellent quantitative abilities and:


A degree in economics, statistics, mathematics, computer science, engineering, physics, or similar fields
In-depth understanding of mathematical and statistical concepts behind most common machine learning techniques and a proven interest in causal inference questions, e.g., A/B tests
Experience in coding and working with data (from a previous research or industry internship or extensive course projects) using a wide range of tools and languages: Python (Pandas, XGBoost/LightGBM), R (dplyr, ggplot2), and git
Ability to see solutions and opportunities that others do not see
High level of commitment and reliability, good balance of pragmatism and perfectionism
Business proficiency in German



Bonus if skilled in any of the following tools and/or languages:


SQL
Tensorflow
Keras
Cloud infrastructure
Docker
Lower-level languages like C#/C++/C



What We Offer

You will be part of a smart, motivated, and driven team that revels in working on challenging problems and finding novel solutions; values our customers and users; and strives to deliver thoughtful and impactful products. You will be surrounded by people that respect each other and the contributions each of us brings. We offer a generous compensation package that includes a base salary, bonus, stock options, and relocation support along with additional location-based benefits.

About QuantCo

At QuantCo, we leverage expertise in data science, engineering, and economics to help organizations turn data into decisions. Started by 4 PhDs from Harvard and Stanford, we are now more than 180 professionals with extensive quantitative, engineering, and business experience. We are globally distributed with offices in Berlin, Boston, Cologne, Karlsruhe, London, Munich, San Francisco, and Zurich.

Our solutions include algorithmic pricing, data-driven claims management, and high-dimensional forecasting systems. Our customers include some of the largest financial, retail, and healthcare organizations in the US and Europe. We impact core business processes and decisions by combining advanced data-driven insights with scalable engineering solutions.

We are excited about writing mission-critical code that affects millions of people and impacts billions of dollars. If you feel the same way, we look forward to hearing from you.

QuantCo does not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.
Show more

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
I am collaborating with a very exciting, incredibly well backed, start up, Biotech company with offices in Amsterdam and Zurich







My client uses their data platform, multi-modal foundation models, and derived applications, to uncover deep insights within data to transform healthcare delivery and enhance patient outcomes.







They are looking for a highly skilled Machine Learning Engineer with a strong research background to join their Multimodal Team. The ideal candidate will have expertise in working with vision and language modalities, with a preference for experience in their fusion. While a medical background is a plus, it is not required; their primary focus is on advanced ML engineering capabilities.







Key Responsibilities







Develop and optimize machine learning models for multimodal applications, with a focus on vision and language modalities.
Design and implement scalable machine learning systems, particularly for large-scale distributed training environments.
Utilize PyTorch and PyTorch Lightning to build, train, and deploy ML models, ensuring robust performance and efficiency.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate ML models into production environments.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in machine learning, particularly in multimodal and distributed systems.
Participate in code reviews, contribute to the development of best practices, and mentor junior engineers.










Qualifications







Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, or a related field. A Ph.D. is a plus but not required.
Proven experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, with a focus on vision and language modalities.
Strong background in developing and deploying machine learning models at scale, particularly in distributed settings.
Extensive experience with PyTorch and PyTorch Lightning, including large-scale training and deployment.
Experience in large language model (LLM) training (pre-training or post-training) is highly desirable.







Preferred Qualifications:







Experience with multimodal fusion techniques.
Familiarity with medical applications of machine learning is a plus, but not mandatory.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders.







Benefits







Comprehensive salary
Long term incentives
25+ days holiday
Clear development pathway










Following your application Joe Templeman, a specialist AI Recruiter will discuss the opportunity with you in detail.







He will be more than happy to answer any questions relating to the industry and the potential for your career growth. The conversation can also progress further to discussing other opportunities, which are also available right now or will be imminently becoming available.







This position has been highly popular, and it is likely that it will close prematurely. We recommend applying as soon as possible to avoid disappointment.







Please click ‘apply’ or contact Joe Templeman for any further information

Joe Templeman

Recruitment Manager – Barrington James

Email: jtempleman (at) barringtonjames.com

Title: Applied Scientist, NLP
Description:
Are you excited about working at the forefront of applied research in an industry setting? Thomson Reuters Labs in Zug is seeking scientists with a passion for solving problems using state-of-the-art information retrieval, natural language processing and generative AI.

What does Thomson Reuters Labs do? We experiment, we build, we deliver. We support the organization and our customers through applied research in informational retrieval and natural language processing. We work closely with product and domain experts to identify compelling solutions at the intersection of user need and technical feasibility.

About The Role

As an Applied Scientist, you will:


Experiment and Develop: You will execute the entire model development lifecycle, from prototype to delivery, while applying best practices for reproducible research and well-managed software delivery.
Collaborate: Working on a collaborative cross-functional team, you will share information, value diverse ideas, and partner effectively with colleagues across the globe.
Deliver: You will be accountable for timely, well-managed deliverables.
Innovate: You will be empowered to try new approaches and learn new technologies. You will implement innovative ideas to solve real-world challenges.
Inspire: You will be a proactive communicator who is excited to share your work. You will be articulate and compelling in describing ideas to both technical and non-technical audiences.



About You

You’re a fit for the role of Applied Scientist, NLP if your background includes:

Basic Qualifications


PhD in a relevant discipline or Master’s plus a comparable level of experience.
At least one year industry experience building IR/NLP/ML systems
Solid software engineering skills for prototyping
Outstanding communication and data analysis skills



Preferred Qualifications


5+ years practical experience building IR, ML or NLP systems in academia or industry
Experience designing and implementing solutions with large language models
Relevant publications at ACL, EMNLP, NAACL, NeurIPS, ICLR, SIGIR, KDD, or similar.
Advanced proficiency in Python, Java, or Scala
Experience writing production quality code and contributing to well-managed software delivery.



What's in it For You?

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:


Hybrid Work Model: We’ve adopted a flexible hybrid working environment (2-3 days a week in the office depending on the role) for our office-based roles while delivering a seamless experience that is digitally and physically connected
Wellbeing: Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: flexible vacation, two company-wide Mental Health Days Off; work from another location for up to a total of 8 weeks in a year, 4 of those weeks can be out of the country and the remaining in the country, Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing.
Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more.
Learning & Development: LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking.
Social Impact: Ten employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact.
Purpose Driven Work: We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.



DISCLAIMER

The above information in this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward.

Accessibility

As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.

We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law.

As an Applied Scientist, you will:

  • Experiment and Develop: You will execute the entire model development lifecycle, from prototype to delivery, while applying best practices for reproducible research and well-managed software delivery.
  • Collaborate: Working on a collaborative cross-functional team, you will share information, value diverse ideas, and partner effectively with colleagues across the globe.
  • Deliver: You will be accountable for timely, well-managed deliverables.
  • Innovate: You will be empowered to try new approaches and learn new technologies. You will implement innovative ideas to solve real-world challenges.
  • Inspire: You will be a proactive communicator who is excited to share your work. You will be articulate and compelling in describing ideas to both technical and non-technical audiences.


About You

You’re a fit for the role of Applied Scientist, NLP if your background includes:

Basic Qualifications

  • PhD in a relevant discipline or Master’s plus a comparable level of experience.
  • At least one year industry experience building IR/NLP/ML systems
  • Solid software engineering skills for prototyping
  • Outstanding communication and data analysis skills


Preferred Qualifications

  • 5+ years practical experience building IR, ML or NLP systems in academia or industry
  • Experience designing and implementing solutions with large language models
  • Relevant publications at ACL, EMNLP, NAACL, NeurIPS, ICLR, SIGIR, KDD, or similar.
  • Advanced proficiency in Python, Java, or Scala
  • Experience writing production quality code and contributing to well-managed software delivery.


What's in it For You?

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

  • Hybrid Work Model: We’ve adopted a flexible hybrid working environment (2-3 days a week in the office depending on the role) for our office-based roles while delivering a seamless experience that is digitally and physically connected
  • Wellbeing: Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: flexible vacation, two company-wide Mental Health Days Off; work from another location for up to a total of 8 weeks in a year, 4 of those weeks can be out of the country and the remaining in the country, Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing.
  • Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more.
  • Learning & Development: LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking.
  • Social Impact: Ten employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact.
  • Purpose Driven Work: We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.


DISCLAIMER

The above information in this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward.

Accessibility

As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.

We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law.

Title: Junior Software Engineer (C+, Python) (EP-SFT-2024-128-GRAE)
Description:
Job Description

Your responsibilities

Are you a recently-graduated scientist interested in contributing to scientific software, or a software engineer keen on diving into the challenges of High Energy Physics data processing? Do you like intuitive, simple and powerful interfaces? Join the ROOT team (https://root.cern) and become a core contributor to the software R&D at the heart of LHC data processing.

In Particular, You Will


Improve the usage and feel of ROOT as a Python package.
Improve the ergonomics of Python interfaces offered by ROOT statistics and analysis tools such as histograms, graphs or RDataFrame.
Contribute to the baseline support and maintenance tasks of the project.


Your profile

Skills and/or knowledge

The following list of skills (in order of priority) characterises the ideal candidate:


Experience with software version control (e.g. git)
Knowledge of the C++ language: how to write, compile and run programs; developing code for a package; concepts of thread-safety
Python knowledge and experience with writing code for a repository


Optional But a Plus


Basic knowledge of Python packages for distributed analysis (e.g. Dask, PySpark, Ray)
Experience with using ROOT
Experience with HEP experiments code, their data lifecycle and analysis workflows


Eligibility Criteria


You are a national of a CERN Member or Associate Member State.
By the application deadline, you have a maximum of two years of professional experience since graduation in STEM (or a related field) and your highest educational qualification is either a Bachelor's or Master's degree.
You have never had a CERN fellow or graduate contract before.
Applicants without University degree are not eligible.
Applicants with a PhD are not eligible.


Additional Information

Job closing date: September 1 at 23:59 AM hrs CEST.

Job reference: EP-SFT-2024-128-GRAE

Contract duration: 24 months, with a possible extension up to 36 months maximum.

Target start date: 01-October-2024

What We Offer


A monthly stipend ranging between 5134 and 5647 Swiss Francs (net of tax).
Coverage by CERN's comprehensive health scheme (for yourself, your spouse and children), and membership of the CERN Pension Fund.
Depending on your individual circumstances: installation grant; family, child and infant allowances; payment of travel expenses at the beginning and end of contract.
30 days of paid leave per year.
On-the-job and formal training at CERN as well as in-house language courses for English and/or French.


About Us

At CERN, the European Organization for Nuclear Research, physicists and engineers are probing the fundamental structure of the universe. Using the world's largest and most complex scientific instruments, they study the basic constituents of matter - fundamental particles that are made to collide together at close to the speed of light. The process gives physicists clues about how particles interact, and provides insights into the fundamental laws of nature. Find out more on http://home.cern.

Diversity has been an integral part of CERN's mission since its foundation and is an established value of the Organization. Employing a diverse workforce is central to our success.

Title: Senior Data Scientist (f/m/d)
Description:
Workload: 100%

Join us as a Senior Data Scientist in our Advanced Analytics Team at Axpo, where you will play a pivotal role in advancing the Data Analytics and Machine Learning capabilities within our Trading and Sales Business. As an integral member of our motivated team, you will closely collaborate with cross-functional professionals to drive the development and implementation of innovative data solutions.

What you will do:


Design, implement, and operate advanced data solutions within a professional cloud-based analytics framework to enhance the efficiency and profitability of our energy trading activities.
Collaborate closely with trading desks to understand emerging challenges and deliver data-driven insights through market analysis, statistical modeling, and optimization methods.
Apply state-of-the-art machine learning techniques to optimize trading strategies and decision-making processes, including explainers and drift methodologies to assess model accuracy and reliability.
Engage proactively in insight creation using backtesting and scenario analysis, translating them into impactful business opportunities.
Utilize data visualization and storytelling techniques to effectively communicate complex data insights.
Shape and expand the Advanced Analytics use case portfolio across Europe.
Collaborate with an international team of Data Engineers and Scientists in a dedicated data environment.



What you bring & who you are:


Master’s degree in Data Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or equivalent practical experience.
Proven experience with machine learning algorithms and time series analysis, applied to data-driven trading strategies or decision-making processes.
Strong conceptual skills and the ability to engage with diverse audiences to promote and democratize Advanced Analytics use cases in energy trading.
Ability to prototype ideas, perform critical analysis, and use pragmatic approaches to solve complex tasks while effectively translating business requirements into actionable plans for successful implementation.
High proficiency in Python and query languages such as SQL.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI).
Familiarity with MLOps best practices, including the deployment, monitoring, and management of models running in production.
Team player with an entrepreneurial mindset, open to collaboration and knowledge sharing.
Proficient in English.



About the team:

At Axpo, you will join a motivated and dynamic team that collaborates closely with various cross-functional professionals across the organization. Our Advanced Analytics Team is dedicated to empowering data analytics and machine learning capabilities within the Trading and Sales Business, driving the development of innovative data solutions on a European level. We value creativity, innovation, and the ability to translate business requirements into valuable outcomes, fostering an environment where your expertise can grow.

Title: MLOps Engineer
Description:
Our client, a ML focused consultancy in Switzerland who empower organizations to harness the full potential of data and AI.




We’re looking for a talented Data & MLOps Engineer to join their dynamic team and help our clients turn cutting-edge AI solutions into scalable, impactful realities.




Why Join ?

• 🚀 Lead the way in operationalizing AI solutions, ensuring they deliver beyond prototypes and pilots.

•🌍 Work on high-impact projects that span industries and geographies, making a difference worldwide.

• 🧠 Establish yourself as a trusted advisor in DataOps and MLOps, guiding clients through their digital transformation journeys.




Your Key Responsibilities:

• 🔍 Use your expertise in data, software, and machine learning engineering to guide clients through the challenges of digital transformation.

• 🔧 Design and implement data pipelines, ML integrations, and reliability engineering practices to ensure scalable and reliable solutions.

• 🏗️ Contribute to our innovative solution blueprints, like our ‘Digital Highway for Data & ML systems.’

• 📢 Take ownership of your work, lead technical discussions, and share your knowledge with our team and clients.




What We’re Looking For:

• 💼 Minimum 3 years in Data, Machine Learning, or Software Engineering.

• 🛠️ Strong hands-on experience with programming languages, distributed systems, SQL/NoSQL databases, cloud services, and more.

• 🎓 Familiarity with major data and AI platforms like Snowflake, Databricks, and Dataiku.

• 🌐 Fluent in German and English, with experience in client-facing roles.




Why?

• 🌟 Engage with the latest in data, AI, and analytics to make a real impact across industries.

• 🤝 Join a performance-driven, customer-focused team that values teamwork and knowledge sharing.

• 🏡 Enjoy a hybrid working model that balances client needs with internal commitments.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Expleo propose une offre unique de services intégrés d'ingénierie, qualité et conseil stratégique pour la transformation digitale. Dans un contexte d'accélération technologique sans précédent, nous sommes le partenaire de confiance des entreprises qui innovent. Nous les aidons à développer un avantage compétitif et à améliorer le quotidien de millions de personnes.

Intégrer Expleo Switzerland, C’est 19 000 Collaborateurs, Dans 32 Pays, Avec €1.5Md De CA En 2023, Mais Également


Avoir un accompagnement technique et humain à chaque projet et un suivi performant de votre carrière
Réaliser des formations pour développer ses capacités professionnelles
Participer à des événements spéciaux dédiés
Intégrer une équipe dynamique


Data Scientist (HF)

Afin d’accompagner notre croissance en Suisse, nous recherchons un Data Scientist (H/F) dont la mission principale sera d'accompagner le domaine métier « Industrialisation » d’un de nos clients dans le secteur de l’horlogerie,

Mission


Accompagner le département industrialisation dans la construction de la vision stratégique des outils de data science
Elaborer des solutions de data science permettant de répondre aux besoins métier.
Identifier et formaliser le besoin en collaboration avec le métier et animer des ateliers.
Formuler les cahiers des charges des modèles de Machine Learning (ML).
Promouvoir les bonnes pratiques d’industrialisation des solutions de Data Science.
Mettre au point les prototypes Data Science et démontrer la valeur des solutions élaborées.
Concevoir et exécuter les tests nécessaires à la mise en production des livrables Data Science.
Permettre l’industrialisation des solutions prototypées en collaboration avec l'IT.
Collaborer à l’élaboration des interfaces permettant une utilisation élargie des modèles de Data Science.
Accompagner le métier dans l'optique d'évoluer vers une "data driven company".


Profil


Bachelor/Master en Ingénierie industrielle complétée par un Master en Data Science.
Expérience en milieu industriel et expérience démontrée de 5 ans en Data Science.
Pratique avérée de la Business analyse.
Connaissances nécessaires de Python, Machine Learning, Dataiku.
Leadership, autonomie, rigueur, proactivité.
Capacité à proposer et challenger les positions établies.
Aisance dans la communication avec tous types d'interlocuteurs, sens relationnel, goût pour le travail en équipe.


Seules les candidatures des citoyens suisses et de l'UE seront prises en compte / Nos postes sont accessibles aux personnes en situation de handicap / Télétravail possible

Title: Platform Engineer / Ingenieur | Zurich, CH
Description:
Skills

Our client in the private banking sector is currently looking for a Platform Engineer with strong skills in Apache Kafka, APIs, and DevOps to take their application landscape to the new level. This project will initially run for 1 year and will then likely be extended. To be a successful Platform Engineer, we think the following skills and experiences should be in someone's resumé:


Kafka Expertise: In-depth knowledge of Apache Kafka architecture, including topics, brokers, and proficiency in Kafka APIs, such as Producer and Consumer API, Kafka Streams API, and Kafka Connect API.
API Gateway Knowledge: Experience with any one of API Gateway technologies (e.g., Kong, Apigee) for managing and securing APIs.
Programming Languages: Strong skills in one of the languages such as Java, GO, and Python for developing Kafka applications. Familiarity with scripting languages like Bash, PHP, PowerShell, or Perl for automation tasks.
DevOps and CI/CD: Understanding of DevOps practices, including CI/CD pipelines for automating testing and deployment processes.
Distributed Systems: Strong understanding of distributed systems concepts, including replication, partitioning, and fault tolerance.
Monitoring and Logging: Familiarity with monitoring tools (e.g., Grafana, Kafka Manager) and logging frameworks to ensure system performance and reliability.
Automation and Scripting: Strong scripting and automation skills for managing infrastructure and deployments.
OS and Containers: Good hands-on experience with Linux and Kubernetes.


If the above aligns well with your experiences and interests, we would love to hear from you! Once we receive your CV, we will review it and get in touch with you should your expertise match the requirements of the role mentioned above.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer (Lausanne)
Description:
Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer

Type: Permanent contract

Location: Switzerland (Lausanne or Zurich)

About Us

At Visium, we enable enterprise executives in defining their AI & Data strategy, executing large scale transformations and implementing AI across operations, ensuring their organization becomes future-proof.

With expertise in strategy, architecture, cloud engineering, analytics, artificial intelligence and machine learning, we empower our clients to unleash and scale the power of their data.

We're on a mission to pioneer a bright future and build future-proof and ethical organizations. Join the curious, the ambitious, the doers, the good-hearted, the ones who build a world we're all in awe of - our Visumees.

Ready to become one?

Role

As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer, you will assume a technical leadership role in designing, implementing and deploying innovative solutions with tangible business impact. Join our growing team and contribute to our expansion in Switzerland and internationally

Coupling state-of-the-art Machine Learning techniques with best practices in Software Engineering you will build robust and scalable applications that empower our clients to drive meaningful value from their data. You are passionate about understanding client needs to drive top-notch customer experience and adoption. Finally, you are meticulously organized and prepared to work in a fast-paced and dynamic team environment.

Requirements

Embark on a rewarding journey where you


Proactively take ownership of projects, making decisions and ensuring successful outcomes
Embrace challenges as opportunities to learn, actively seeking and sharing feedback to expand your skills
Exhibit genuine empathy, understanding diverse perspectives and fostering a collaborative and team-oriented atmosphere
Have strong communication skills and the ability to present insights to non-technical and technical stakeholders in an accessible way


In addition, this should be part of your background to apply


4+ years of professional experience as a Machine Learning or Data Scientist or in a relevant role
Experience with ML/DL frameworks and tools in Python (e.g., Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, huggingface/transformers)
Proficiency in Software Development best practices (e.g., Object-Oriented Programming, Design Patterns, Agile Methodology)
Experience in applying deep learning approaches, such as recurrent and convolutional neural networks and transformer models
Experience with MLOps best practices and tools (e.g., dvc, MLFlow, tfX, Kubeflow)
Experience developing and deploying ML solutions using Cloud services (e.g., AWS Sagemaker, GCP Vertex.AI, Azure ML)
Familiarity with REST API and microservices


The following are a plus


Experience with Data and AI platforms (Databricks, Dataiku, Snowflake) or an associated Data Engineer certification
Experience working in a client-facing or consulting role
Familiarity with Generative AI models & tools (e.g., langchain, OpenAI API, LLama2)
Familiarity with web development (e.g., Next.js, React, FastAPI, Flask)



Benefits

What we offer


A competitive compensation package
A yearly education budget to steep your learning curve
A yearly sport budget because a fit body leads to a fit mind
A flexible working culture because your work-life balance matters to us
A position that enables you to have an impact on 1'000s of people, and the whole company's growth
An international, knowledgeable, and passionate team with a strong collaborative mindset


Check our LinkedIn and website to learn more about us & don't hesitate to contact us if you have any questions.

At Visium, we enable enterprise executives in defining their AI & Data strategy, executing large scale transformations and implementing AI across operations, ensuring their organization becomes future-proof.

With expertise in strategy, architecture, cloud engineering, analytics, artificial intelligence and machine learning, we empower our clients to unleash and scale the power of their data.

We're on a mission to pioneer a bright future and build future-proof and ethical organizations. Join the curious, the ambitious, the doers, the good-hearted, the ones who build a world we're all in awe of - our Visumees.

Ready to become one?

Role

As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer, you will assume a technical leadership role in designing, implementing and deploying innovative solutions with tangible business impact. Join our growing team and contribute to our expansion in Switzerland and internationally

Coupling state-of-the-art Machine Learning techniques with best practices in Software Engineering you will build robust and scalable applications that empower our clients to drive meaningful value from their data. You are passionate about understanding client needs to drive top-notch customer experience and adoption. Finally, you are meticulously organized and prepared to work in a fast-paced and dynamic team environment.

Requirements

Embark on a rewarding journey where you

  • Proactively take ownership of projects, making decisions and ensuring successful outcomes
  • Embrace challenges as opportunities to learn, actively seeking and sharing feedback to expand your skills
  • Exhibit genuine empathy, understanding diverse perspectives and fostering a collaborative and team-oriented atmosphere
  • Have strong communication skills and the ability to present insights to non-technical and technical stakeholders in an accessible way

In addition, this should be part of your background to apply

  • 4+ years of professional experience as a Machine Learning or Data Scientist or in a relevant role
  • Experience with ML/DL frameworks and tools in Python (e.g., Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, huggingface/transformers)
  • Proficiency in Software Development best practices (e.g., Object-Oriented Programming, Design Patterns, Agile Methodology)
  • Experience in applying deep learning approaches, such as recurrent and convolutional neural networks and transformer models
  • Experience with MLOps best practices and tools (e.g., dvc, MLFlow, tfX, Kubeflow)
  • Experience developing and deploying ML solutions using Cloud services (e.g., AWS Sagemaker, GCP Vertex.AI, Azure ML)
  • Familiarity with REST API and microservices

The following are a plus

  • Experience with Data and AI platforms (Databricks, Dataiku, Snowflake) or an associated Data Engineer certification
  • Experience working in a client-facing or consulting role
  • Familiarity with Generative AI models & tools (e.g., langchain, OpenAI API, LLama2)
  • Familiarity with web development (e.g., Next.js, React, FastAPI, Flask)


Benefits

What we offer

  • A competitive compensation package
  • A yearly education budget to steep your learning curve
  • A yearly sport budget because a fit body leads to a fit mind
  • A flexible working culture because your work-life balance matters to us
  • A position that enables you to have an impact on 1'000s of people, and the whole company's growth
  • An international, knowledgeable, and passionate team with a strong collaborative mindset

Check our LinkedIn and website to learn more about us & don't hesitate to contact us if you have any questions.

Title: AI Solution Engineer
Description:
About Us

Axelera AI is not your regular deep-tech startup. We are creating the next-generation AI platform to support anyone who wants to help advancing humanity and improve the world around us.

In just three years, we have raised a total of $120 million and have built a world-class team of 180+ employees (including 55+ PhDs with more than 40,000 citations), both remotely from 11 different countries and with offices in Belgium, Switzerland, Italy, the UK, headquartered at the High Tech Campus in Eindhoven, Netherlands.

We have also launched our Metis™ AI Platform, which achieves a 3-5x increase in efficiency and performance, and have visibility into a strong business pipeline exceeding $100 million.

Our unwavering commitment to innovation has firmly established us as a global industry pioneer.

Are you up for the challenge?

Position Overview:

We are seeking a talented and experienced AI Solution Engineer with expertise in machine learning and computer vision to join our dynamic team. As a Solution Engineer at Axelera AI, you will play a critical role in designing and implementing AI-driven solutions tailored to our clients' specific needs. You will work closely with clients, sales teams, and technical stakeholders to understand requirements, develop solution designs, and oversee the implementation of scalable and robust machine learning systems.

Responsibilities:


Collaborate with clients to understand their business objectives, challenges, and requirements for AI-driven solutions.
Design end-to-end machine learning and computer vision architectures and solutions that address client needs while adhering to best practices and industry standards.
Optimize the different stages of a computer vision pipeline, including pre- and post-processing.
Work closely with sales teams to develop proposals, including solution designs, technical approaches, and project timelines.
Lead technical discussions and presentations with clients to articulate solution designs, capabilities, and value propositions.
Provide technical guidance and leadership to cross-functional teams during solution implementation, ensuring alignment with architectural designs and project goals.
Evaluate and recommend appropriate machine learning algorithms, frameworks, and technologies to achieve desired outcomes.
Collaborate with data scientists and engineers to prototype, develop, and deploy machine learning models and applications.
Conduct performance optimizations, scalability assessments, and troubleshooting to ensure robust and efficient solution delivery.
Stay abreast of the latest advancements in machine learning, AI technologies, and industry trends to continuously enhance expertise and contribute to innovation.
Mentor junior team members, share knowledge, and foster a culture of learning and collaboration within the organization.


Requirements:


Proven experience (5 years) as an engineer in designing and implementing computer vision solutions.
Strong proficiency in machine learning concepts, algorithms, and techniques, with hands-on experience in developing, training and deploying ML models.
Excellent knowledge and understanding of state-of-art convolution- and transformer based neural networks for recognition, detection, segmentation, key-point detection, etc.
Proficiency in Python and C/C++, along with experience with machine learning libraries/frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, OpenCV, Tensorflow, scikit-learn).
Strong working experience with different hardware platforms, camera’s, Lidars, and other other sensors
Working experience with Ubuntu and other operating systems
Experience with gstreamer, Cuda, TensorRT is a plus
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to effectively communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Experience with agile methodologies, DevOps practices, and CI/CD pipelines is a plus.
Relevant certifications in machine learning, cloud computing, or architecture (e.g., AWS Certified Solutions Architect, Google Cloud Professional Architect) are desirable.
A passion for innovation, continuous learning, and a collaborative mindset.


Location

We offer a flexible working arrangement, with options to:


Work from one of our Axelera AI offices (Leuven in Belgium, Amsterdam and Eindhoven in the Netherlands, Zurich in Switzerland, Florence and Milan in Italy or Bristol in the United Kingdom) if you're already based in the vicinity.
Work fully remotely from any European country (incl. the UK) you are already in.
Relocate with us and work from Amsterdam or Eindhoven (Netherlands) or Florence (Italy).


What We  offer

This is your chance to shape and be part of a dynamic, fast-growing, international organization. We offer an attractive compensation package, including a pension plan, extensive employee insurances and the option to get company shares. 

An open culture that supports creativity and continual innovation is awaiting you. Collaborative ownership and freedom with responsibility is characteristic for the way we act and work as a team.

At Axelera AI, we wholeheartedly embrace equal opportunity and hold diversity in the highest regard. Our steadfast commitment is to cultivate a warm and inclusive environment that empowers and celebrates every member of our team. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds to join us in shaping the future of AI.
Show more

Title: Rust Developer
Description:
Location: Anywhere in the World Permanent Remote (Europe, Latam, Asia )

Contract length -6 Months

Opportunity- Full Time, 8 hours,

Must-Have

Total Years Of exp- 4+ years experience mandatory

Mandatory Skills: Rust - min 3 yrs, CI/CD - min 3 yrs, Git - min 3 yrs

About The Role

We are seeking a proficient Rust Developer with a strong interest in machine learning and human-computer interaction to join our team. In this role, you will contribute to the development and refinement of large language models (LLMs) by participating in Reinforcement Learning from Human Feedback (RLHF) tasks. Your work will involve building tools to facilitate human feedback, as well as directly providing insights to guide the training and improvement of LLMs

Key Responsibilities


Participate in RLHF tasks by providing human feedback on LLM outputs, helping to guide model training.
Evaluate the responses generated by LLMs, identifying areas where the model needs improvement and providing qualitative feedback.
Work closely with data scientists and ML engineers to ensure that feedback is accurately reflected in the model’s learning process.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand the requirements for human feedback in the RLHF process.
Provide insights into how human feedback can be systematically incorporated into model training and improvement.
Document processes and best practices for providing and integrating human feedback in LLM training.
Stay informed about the latest advancements in reinforcement learning, LLMs, and human-computer interaction.
Experiment with new methods and tools to improve the collection and integration of human feedback in RLHF tasks.


Requirements

Technical Skills:


3+ years of experience in Rust development, with a solid understanding of systems programming, performance optimization, and concurrency.
Familiarity with machine learning concepts, particularly reinforcement learning, is highly desirable.
Experience with human-computer interaction, user feedback systems, or similar domains is a plus.
Proficiency with version control systems (e.g., Git) and CI/CD pipelines.
Analytical Skills:
Strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to analyze and improve the efficiency of RLHF tasks.
Experience in evaluating and providing constructive feedback on AI/ML outputs.


Skills: git,reinforcement learning,reinforcement,machine learning,analytical skills,version control systems,problem-solving,ai/ml,concurrency,problem-solving skills,ci,rust,ci/cd,user feedback systems,performance optimization,ci/cd pipelines,cd,systems programming,human-computer interaction,learning
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
MAIN DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE ROLE:

The opportunity is to join a one of Brevan Howard's largest portfolio management teams in Geneva as a data scientist to work on data-driven research projects including using the latest tools in AI. The hire will work closely with senior portfolio managers and a team of research analysts.

Responsibilities will include

Design, develop and evolve research workflow & full stack of data science tools Develop and maintain engineering best practices including focus on high standards across all stages of research Collaborate with other members to translate their needs into scalable, standardized solutions Building new tools for conducting statistical analysis over large datasets Designing infrastructure to more effectively leverage compute cluster

As such the candidate should have very strong programming skills (Python, Java (or C++), SQL) and must have experience working with large data sets covering different data types (numerical, text, other) and be adaptable to rapidly changing requirements.

WORK EXPERIENCE/BACKGROUNDTECHNICAL/BUSINESS SKILLS & KNOWLEDGE:

Essential

PHD or masters (with experience) in a quantitative field such as computer science, statistics, mathematics, or a related field. Will also consider candidates with submissions to machine learning competitions or publically available code repos. Demonstrable very strong coding skills (Python, Java (or C++), SQL), Well-versed in machine learning techniques such as supervised and unsupervised learning, natural language processing, and deep learning Solid foundation in statistics and be able to perform various statistical analyses such as hypothesis testing, regression analysis, and time-series analysis Broad knowledge & experience of database concepts with proficiency in SQL, databases and big data technologies Knowledge of financial data - both numerical and textual Experience in processing large and complex datasets Emphasis in good engineering practices, design, testing and strategic solutions Strong communication skills Self-motivated, proactive Ability to perform well under pressure Enthusiastic, flexible and adaptable Ability to work effectively and independently as well as part of a team Good interpersonal skills

Desirable

Other candidates with submissions to machine learning competitions, such as Kaggle, are also encouraged to apply. Participation in these competitions demonstrates a strong interest and aptitude in data science and machine learning.

TECHNICAL/BUSINESS SKILLS & KNOWLEDGE:

Essential

Programming: you should have strong programming skills in languages such as Python. These skills will enable you to manipulate, analyse and visualize large datasets Machine learning: you should be well-versed in machine learning techniques such as supervised and unsupervised learning, natural language processing, and deep learning Statistical analysis: you should have a solid foundation in statistics and be able to perform various statistical analyses such as hypothesis testing, regression analysis, and time-series analysis Data visualization: you should be able to present data in a clear and compelling manner using data visualization tools Communication: you should be able to effectively communicate complex data-driven insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders Problem-solving: you should be able to identify and solve complex problems using data-driven approaches Continuous learning: you should be committed to continuous learning and staying up-to-date with the latest technologies and trends in data science and finance

Desirable

Knowledge of latest LLM models and their capabilities / weaknesses Knowledge in advanced AI methodologies
Show more

Title: Automation Software Engineer (a)
Description:
Einführung

Für ein schweizer Unternehmen suchen wir zur Verstärkung des Teams eine engagierte und qualifizierte Person für die Position des Automation Software Engineers (a).




Sie sind ein führendes Unternehmen in der Entwicklung und Herstellung von Lösungen zur Verarbeitung von Polyurethan und anderen Reaktionsgemischen.




Verantwortlichkeiten

Umsetzung des gesamten Prozesses der Softwareentwicklung im Bereich Steuerungs- und Automationstechnik für Highend Produkte (Anforderungsanalyse, Konzeption, Realisierung und Implementierung)
Erstellen von Visualisierungen (HMI) mit modernen Web-Technologien
Erstellen von Schnittstellenbeschreibungen, Spezifikationen, Funktionsabläufen, Bedien- und Testkonzepten
Weiterentwicklung von internen softwaretechnischen Standards
Softwaretests und Inbetriebnahmen in-house ggf. bei den Kunden im In- und Ausland
Troubleshooting per Ferndiagnose, manches aber auch vor Ort




Qualifikationen

Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Automation, Elektrotechnik, Informatik, Mechatronik oder Maschinenbau
Nachweisbare Erfahrung im Bereich Softwareentwicklung, Steuerungs- und Automationstechnik
Selbständige, strukturierte und dienstleistungsorientierte Persönlichkeit
Lösungsorientierte, analytische und präzise Arbeitsweise
Deutsch in Wort und Schrift sowie sehr gute Englischkenntnisse




Vorteile

International tätiges und etabliertes KMU
Transparente Kommunikationswege, flache Hierarchie und eine wertschätzende Firmenkultur
Offene Zusammenarbeit mit gegenseitigem Respekt und Vertrauen
Dynamisches, motiviertes und aufgeschlossenes Team
Attraktive Anstellungs- und Arbeitsbedingungen mit guten Sozialleistungen




Bewerbungsinformationen

Interessiert? Dann freuen wir uns auf die vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen über unser Online-Bewerbungsformular.

Show more
